h1_tag: 20 Amazing Things To Do In Kerala For An Incredible Holiday
snippet_text: Can you imagine giving a bath to an elephant- Kodanad Elephant Sanctuary is a major attraction in Kerala. 42 kms from Kochi, visit there for some exciting activities like elephant bath, elephant safari and elephant feeding and watching baby elephants too. The rates vary from Rs 350-1500/person depending on the time and activities involved.
snippet_content:

Image Source

blog_post_title: 20 Amazing Things To Do In Kerala For An Incredible Holiday-1
h1_tag: 20 Amazing Things To Do In Kerala For An Incredible Holiday
snippet_inner_link: Must Read: 16 resorts in Kerala you will yearn to be with your sweetheart
snippet_text: Alleppey tops in the list of places to visit in Kerala. Looking at the lush green landscape and being served a freshly prepared meal as you travel through the tranquil backwaters is just as amazing as it is made out to be. The boat accommodates the whole family and includes breakfast, lunch, dinner and snacks. Prices vary from Rs 6500-11500 and its better to call in advance and reserve.
snippet_content:
Houseboat In Alleppey



Image Source

blog_post_title: 20 Amazing Things To Do In Kerala For An Incredible Holiday-2
h1_tag: 20 Amazing Things To Do In Kerala For An Incredible Holiday
h2_tag: 3. Watch the Neelakurinji Bloom in Munnar
snippet_heading: Watch The Neelakurinji Bloom In Munnar
snippet_text: Eravikulam National Park- is one the most frequented tourist attractions in Kerala because of Neelakurinji, which bloom once in 12 years and this rare view is a fascinating experience. Also see the Nigiri Thar, an endangered mountain goat while going on a trek to the peak of the hill. Tickets are for Rs 55 per adult and the park is closed in Feburary and March.
snippet_content:
Watch The Neelakurinji Bloom In Munnar



Image Source

Eravikulam National Park- is one the most frequented tourist attractions in Kerala because of Neelakurinji, which bloom once in 12 years and this rare view is a fascinating experience. Also see the Nigiri Thar, an endangered mountain goat while going on a trek to the peak of the hill. Tickets are for Rs 55 per adult and the park is closed in Feburary and March.

blog_post_title: 20 Amazing Things To Do In Kerala For An Incredible Holiday-3
h1_tag: 20 Amazing Things To Do In Kerala For An Incredible Holiday
h2_tag: 4. Enjoy Village life for a day
snippet_heading: Enjoy Village Life For A Day
snippet_inner_link: Must Read: Myth Busted: Travel Packages not a luxury anymore!
snippet_text: Have an authentic rural experience at Kumbalangi Integrated Tourism Village. Exploring the local paddy cultivation, canoeing in mangrove forests, fishing, crab farming are amongst the many things to do in the village. Many homestays are available in the village which can be booked by the visitors. The village is 14 kms from Ernakulam railway station.
snippet_content:
Enjoy Village Life For A Day



Image Source

Have an authentic rural experience at Kumbalangi Integrated Tourism Village. Exploring the local paddy cultivation, canoeing in mangrove forests, fishing, crab farming are amongst the many things to do in the village. Many homestays are available in the village which can be booked by the visitors. The village is 14 kms from Ernakulam railway station.

blog_post_title: 20 Amazing Things To Do In Kerala For An Incredible Holiday-4
h1_tag: 20 Amazing Things To Do In Kerala For An Incredible Holiday
h2_tag: 5. Meal at the Veli Tourist Village
snippet_heading: Meal At The Veli Tourist Village
snippet_text: From all the places to visit on your trip to Kerala, exploring the Veli Lake and dining in the floating restaurant at the laske is an incredible experience. Paddle boat in the lake and check out the floating bridge that links the tourist village with the beach. Veli Tourist Village is located at a distance of 8 Km from Thiruvananthapuram.

snippet_inner_link: Must Read: 10 Most Offbeat Kerala Backwaters You Should Explore
snippet_text: About 4 hours from Thiruvananthapuram, Alappuzha offers some stunning views of the backwaters. Other than looking at the village life, the coconut tress, you will also see an array of birds. The double deck boats give a 3-4 hour ride without the expense of a houseboat and costs Rs 600 per hour.

blog_post_title: 20 Amazing Things To Do In Kerala For An Incredible Holiday-6
h1_tag: 20 Amazing Things To Do In Kerala For An Incredible Holiday
snippet_text: Watching the colourful Snake Boat races in Alappuzha is one of the amazing things to do in Kerala. Snake boat races are mostly held from July to September particularly during Onam festival. You can even rent a boat to look at the race from close-by. The closest station is Alleppey which is accessible from Ernakulam.
snippet_content:
Watch The Snake Boat Races



Image Source

You can even rent a boat to look at the race from close-by. The closest station is Alleppey which is accessible from Ernakulam.

blog_post_title: 20 Amazing Things To Do In Kerala For An Incredible Holiday-7
h1_tag: 20 Amazing Things To Do In Kerala For An Incredible Holiday
snippet_text: Number 8 on our list of things to do in Kerala is staying in a Tree House. Get closer to nature and experience the fun of staying in a Tree House at Wayanad, Munnar, Athirapally or Thekkady. You can indulge in activities like rappling, rock climbing, nature walks and mountain biking. The tarrifs for tree houses start from Rs 10000.
snippet_content:
Stay In A Tree House



Image Source

blog_post_title: 20 Amazing Things To Do In Kerala For An Incredible Holiday-8
h1_tag: 20 Amazing Things To Do In Kerala For An Incredible Holiday
snippet_inner_link: Must Read: Foo Paradises of Kerala : Go on a gastronomic joy ride
snippet_text: \nTake a tour of the spice plantations or gardens in Munnar, Thekkady or Wayanad. Taste some authentic black pepper, cardamom, cinnamon and the exotic vanilla and explore the farms on a nature walk. Most hotels include these tours in their packages but you can visit on your own too, like the Abrahams Spice garden in Thekkady which costs only Rs 200 to enter.

blog_post_title: 20 Amazing Things To Do In Kerala For An Incredible Holiday-10
h1_tag: 20 Amazing Things To Do In Kerala For An Incredible Holiday
snippet_text: Fort Kochi is an amazing place to visit in Kerala. With the influence of Arabs, British, Dutch, Chinese, and Portuguese, Fort Kochi has a lot of eclectic architecture to gawk at. Explore the place on foot or on a bicycle including the Jewish synagogue, Indo portuguese museum, Chinese fishing nets-, Santa Cruz Basilica- and Fort Kochi beach.
snippet_content:
Architecture Tour In Fort Kochi



Fort Kochi is an amazing place to visit in Kerala. With the influence of Arabs, British, Dutch, Chinese, and Portuguese, Fort Kochi has a lot of eclectic architecture to gawk at. Explore the place on foot or on a bicycle including the Jewish synagogue, Indo portuguese museum, Chinese fishing nets-, Santa Cruz Basilica- and Fort Kochi beach.
formatted_address: MATHAI MANJURAN ROAD, Kochi, Kerala 682018, India

blog_post_title: 20 Amazing Things To Do In Kerala For An Incredible Holiday-11
h1_tag: 20 Amazing Things To Do In Kerala For An Incredible Holiday
snippet_text: One of the best things to do in Kerala is watching Theyyam. They are staged in various temples of North Kerala, usually in front of the village shrine. Watch this exceptional and beautiful dance form in the districts of Kannur and Kasargod or if you are lucky you can catch a performance in Kerala Museum at Kochi. Make sure you look up the dates of the events on Theyyam calendar online before you visit.
snippet_content:
Watch Theyyam



Image Source

One of the best things to do in Kerala is watching Theyyam. They are staged in various temples of North Kerala, usually in front of the village shrine. Watch this exceptional and beautiful dance form in the districts of Kannur and Kasargod or if you are lucky you can catch a performance in Kerala Museum at Kochi. Make sure you look up the dates of the events on Theyyam calendar online before you visit.
formatted_address: Thayatheru Rd, Thayatheru, Thana, Kannur, Kerala 670012, India

blog_post_title: 20 Amazing Things To Do In Kerala For An Incredible Holiday-12
h1_tag: 20 Amazing Things To Do In Kerala For An Incredible Holiday
snippet_text: This little haven is a marvelous place to visit while in Kerala. Load up some locally cultivated tea in Munnar, 3 hours from Kochi. Visit the Kannan Devan Plantation Museum to witness tea-processing and taste different teas. You can also hire a jeep from Suryanelli (25 kms from Munnar) to visit the Kolukkumalai Tea Estate and a 100 year old factory. Jeep rates vary from Rs 1200-2000.
snippet_content:
Hi Tea In Munnar



Image Source

This little haven is a marvelous place to visit while in Kerala. Load up some locally cultivated tea in Munnar, 3 hours from Kochi. Visit the Kannan Devan Plantation Museum to witness tea-processing and taste different teas. You can also hire a jeep from Suryanelli (25 kms from Munnar) to visit the Kolukkumalai Tea Estate and a 100 year old factory. Jeep rates vary from Rs 1200-2000.

blog_post_title: 20 Amazing Things To Do In Kerala For An Incredible Holiday-13
h1_tag: 20 Amazing Things To Do In Kerala For An Incredible Holiday
snippet_text: For all the nature lovers, Kumarakom Bird Sanctuary- is must to be on your list of places to visit in Kerala. Spot rare migratory birds such as egret, heron, waterfoul, siberian crane, while on a boat cruise. About 3 hours from Kochi, you can easily the destination by bus or taxis. Combine bird watching with a houseboat stay on Vembanad Lake to get the most out of the visit. November to Feburary is the best time to visit this place.
snippet_content:
Bird Watching In Kumarakom



Image Source

Combine bird watching with a houseboat stay on Vembanad Lake to get the most out of the visit. November to Feburary is the best time to visit this place.

blog_post_title: 20 Amazing Things To Do In Kerala For An Incredible Holiday-15
h1_tag: 20 Amazing Things To Do In Kerala For An Incredible Holiday
h2_tag: 16. Take the Periyar Jungle Jeep Ride
snippet_heading: Take The Periyar Jungle Jeep Ride
snippet_text: For the most fascinating experience of the forest, Thekkady should be on the top most list of places you are visiting in Kerala. About 190 kms from Kochi, Thekkady is famous for its diverse forest cover, fauna, mammals and aquatic life. The Periyar jungle ride covers the views of the lovely Iddukki town, Mullaperiyar Dam, the lush green vegetable farms, the sprawling vineyards and if you are lucky the endangered lion tailed macaque. You can also combine this with an overnight camp in a tent or a tree house. The cost for a days trip is Rs 1800/person.
snippet_content:
Take The Periyar Jungle Jeep Ride



Image Source

For the most fascinating experience of the forest, Thekkady should be on the top most list of places you are visiting in Kerala. About 190 kms from Kochi, Thekkady is famous for its diverse forest cover, fauna, mammals and aquatic life. The Periyar jungle ride covers the views of the lovely Iddukki town, Mullaperiyar Dam, the lush green vegetable farms, the sprawling vineyards and if you are lucky the endangered lion tailed macaque. You can also combine this with an overnight camp in a tent or a tree house. The cost for a days trip is Rs 1800/person.

h1_tag: 20 Amazing Things To Do In Kerala For An Incredible Holiday
snippet_text: One of the many attractions in Kerala are the extraordinary, 80-feet tall, which are now called the Niagara Falls of India. 55 kms from the Kochi International Airport, the falls are easily reachable by bus or taxis. The falls are most visited during the monsoons, from June to September.

blog_post_title: 20 Amazing Things To Do In Kerala For An Incredible Holiday-18
h1_tag: 20 Amazing Things To Do In Kerala For An Incredible Holiday
h2_tag: 19. Watch the sunset at Kovalam Beach
snippet_heading: Watch The Sunset At Kovalam Beach
snippet_text: Watch the beautiful sunset at the Kovalam beach, one of the finest beaches in Kerala. About 16 kms from Thiruvananthapuram, the star attractions here are the Lighthouse Beach-, Hawah beach and the much quieter Samudra beach. The landmark lighthouse can be visited everyday between 3PM-5PM.
snippet_content:
Watch The Sunset At Kovalam Beach



Image Source

blog_post_title: Top 20 Things to do in Bangkok-Thailand-0
h1_tag: Top 20 Things to do in Bangkok-Thailand
snippet_text: Talking about things to do in Bangkok and not including the iconic Tuk-Tuk Ride -- Naah! This three wheeled motorized vehicle is used as a cab in Bangkok since World War II. Its a fun way of navigating through the citys cramped lanes. But beware! Mafia Tuk-Tuk gangs are spread all over the place. If they lure you into knowing the most secret (read shady) places around, simply fold your hands and say, mai ow krup.

blog_post_title: Top 20 Things to do in Bangkok-Thailand-1
h1_tag: Top 20 Things to do in Bangkok-Thailand
h2_tag: 2. FLOATING MARKETS : Glimpse of the bygone era
snippet_text: Shopping in the floating markets of Bangkok is an experience that you just cannot miss. These traditionally set up floating markets in boats offer a peek-a-boo into the local way of life. Boats are piled high with all types of shopping items. But watch out! Once you step into the boat that could mean you cant step out without buying something.
snippet_content:
Floating Markets



Image Source

Shopping in the floating markets of Bangkok is an experience that you just cannot miss. These traditionally set up floating markets in boats offer a peek-a-boo into the local way of life. Boats are piled high with all types of shopping items. But watch out! Once you step into the boat that could mean you cant step out without buying something.
formatted_address: Show Dc Entertainment Mall, 99/9-99/6 Rama 9, (next to RCA), Rachada, Bangkok, 10400, Thailand

snippet_text: Chatuchak weekend market, one of the largest markets in the world, seems to accumulate everything buyable possible like apparels, utensils, vintage items, food, etc. It requires a full day to explore this attraction in Bangkok. snippet_text: If you want to delve deeper into the culture and tradition of Thailand, then Thai Village Cultural Show should top your list of places to visit in Bangkok. The show, located in the Rose Garden, includes: Thai boxing match, traditional Thai wedding, sword fighting and traditional finger nail dance. This is your shortcut to experience the culture of Thailand in a matter of hours.

blog_post_title: Top 20 Things to do in Bangkok-Thailand-5
h1_tag: Top 20 Things to do in Bangkok-Thailand
h2_tag: 6. TIGER TEMPLE: Take a Tiger Selfie!
snippet_text: Ever thought about taking a selfie with the big cat- Well everything is possible when you are in Thailand. The Tiger Temple, situated in Kanchanaburi, is a popular tourist attraction where tigers are being raised by the monks (no cages in sight!) You can watch the tigers doing their daily exercises and baby cubs being fed without any caged bars in between. If this doesnt thrill you enough, then you can also go ahead and take a walk with the wild tigers. One of our favorite things to do in Thailand!

blog_post_title: Top 20 Things to do in Bangkok-Thailand-9
h1_tag: Top 20 Things to do in Bangkok-Thailand
h2_tag: 10. WAT PHRA KAEW & GRAND PALACE: Heart of Bangkok
snippet_text: Wat Phra Kaew, also known as The Temple of The Emerald Buddha, is located in a fairy tale compound consecrated in 1782, the first year of Bangkok rule. It represents royal history and architectural experimentation in a tasteful manner. But hold on! It has more than just history to it. The place is surrounded by a range of Thai street food vendors! Well where theres food, everything else can wait!

snippet_text: If you want to get away from the hustle bustle of the city without actually leaving Bangkok then Lumphini Park is the place to be. Serene Environment and some silent moments with your partner, make this park one of the best places to visit in Thailand.

h2_tag: 12. Boat trip to Koh Kret Island: Easiest Getaway!
snippet_heading: Boat Trip To Koh Kret Island
snippet_text: Koh kret is a little artificially created island built almost 300 years ago. It serves as a great escape for a fantastic day trip from Bangkok. Its even better if you visit this island on a weekend. Theres a lot going on in its famous weekend market that rings a bell for some weekend shopping -- one of the best things to do in Bangkok (at least to us)!

h2_tag: 13. VIMANMEK TEAK MANSION : The Golden lining
snippet_text: This palace is yet another example of rich history of Thailand. It contains 81 rooms and is said to be the worlds largest golden-teak building. The best part is, when you visit the Grand Palace, you also receive an entrance ticket for the mansion. So not only you save on your time, you also kill 2 birds with one stone oh! I mean 2 places with one ticket!

blog_post_title: Top 20 Things to do in Bangkok-Thailand-15
h1_tag: Top 20 Things to do in Bangkok-Thailand
h2_tag: 16. Wat Arun Riverside: The Temple of Dawn
snippet_text: The stunning beauty of Wat Arun steals the show easily as one of the most stunning temples in Bangkok. The riverside location and the alluring designs makes the temple stand out from the rest. Partly made up of colorfully decorated spires, the temple offers a beautiful sight during the sunset. You can also climb the steep steps to central prang to unleash your adventurous side! You have to take a river taxi to Tien Pier and then cross the river via ferry to get to the temple.

Though not so close to Delhi, but a road trip to the foothills of Himalayas is tempting enough for a visit to Parwanoo. A fascinating journey along the wide roads which lead to the lush green hills with a pleasant weather and scenic views is worth experiencing in the hot summers or the pre/post monsoon seasons.

Take a cable car ride at the Timber trail resort to the top of the hill and dine at their restaurant offering an ecstatic view of the valley. This is a perfect getaway with friends or your love!

blog_post_title: 12 One Day Road Trips From Delhi-6
h1_tag: 12 One Day Road Trips From Delhi
snippet_text:
Distance: 182 km

Time: 3 hours 40 minutes

Best time to visit: August to November (Breeding Birds) | October to February (Migratory Birds)

A fancy ride on NH2, the Agra-Jaipur highway takes you to a small town and misleading roads until the locals guide you to the Bharatpur Bird Sanctuary or the Keoladeo National Park. The entrance might not appeal to you initially because of the abandoned look & feel, but the interiors of the jungle will leave you mesmerized.

Park your car inside and explore the sanctuary on a rickshaw ride worth Rs.70. The rickshaw puller doubles up as a guide, spotting birds and giving all the details about them.

Visit the temple nearby and carry some atta (wheat flour) along. Wondering why- Let the Pujaari throw balls of atta into the pond adjacent to the temple and see hundreds of healthy turtles come out for food.

Tip: Early morning visit is highly recommended. Also, stay at the Bharatpur forest Lodge for an incredible experience (Room rent -- Rs.2500 approx.)

snippet_text:
Distance: 117 km

Time: 2 hours 30 minutes

Best time to visit: April to May to spot dolphins

For a royal heritage getaway in Uttar Pradesh, head to the 19th century Fort Unchagaon – a perfect destination for a rural experience. The fort is located close to the river Ganga and is surrounded by lush gardens all around. Doesnt yet attract you-

Sight Gangetic dolphins playing in the waters of river Ganges while you relax away from the city. The fort offers interesting activities like billiards, squash, pony rides, village safari, bullock cart ride & pottery making by local artisans.
snippet_content:

Image Source


Distance: 117 km

Time: 2 hours 30 minutes

Best time to visit: April to May to spot dolphins

For a royal heritage getaway in Uttar Pradesh, head to the 19th century Fort Unchagaon – a perfect destination for a rural experience. The fort is located close to the river Ganga and is surrounded by lush gardens all around. Doesnt yet attract you-

Sight Gangetic dolphins playing in the waters of river Ganges while you relax away from the city. The fort offers interesting activities like billiards, squash, pony rides, village safari, bullock cart ride & pottery making by local artisans.

blog_post_title: 12 One Day Road Trips From Delhi-8
h1_tag: 12 One Day Road Trips From Delhi
h2_tag: 8. Road trip to Mathura and Vrindavan
snippet_heading: Road Trip To Mathura And Vrindavan
snippet_text:
Distance: 144 km

Time: 3 hours

Best time to visit: October to March; especially during Holi

For those seeking solace in the temples & spirituality in the air must visit Mathura-Vrindavan. These epic areas hold an important historical reference being the birth place of Lord Krishna & invite each traveller with a warm environment. Sing along the holy chants with the devotees and leave back with wonderful memories of the city.

For all Lord Krishna lovers, visit during the month of August for Janamashtami to experience the magnificent celebrations. Stay over until the pooja ends and taste the delicious Chappan Bhog Prasad.

blog_post_title: 12 One Day Road Trips From Delhi-9
h1_tag: 12 One Day Road Trips From Delhi
snippet_text:
Distance: 202 km

Time: 3 hours 40 minutes

Best time to visit: November to March; especially at the time of Taj Balloon Festival in November and Taj Mahotsav in February

As the name says: this incredible road trip near Delhi on the newly built Yamuna Expressway leads to the city of Love -- Agra. Grand roads, a glimpse to the F1 race tracks and some good music is all you need for this great drive. There have been many accidents on the expressway thus, be very careful with your speed limit.

But Taj is not the only reason you should be visiting this city. There are various outlets on the way serving refreshments and do not forget to try the famous -- Agra ka petha on your trip. Travellers can also try Bidaai and Jalebi available almost everywhere.

h1_tag: 12 One Day Road Trips From Delhi
h2_tag: 10. Road trip to Alwar – Sariska National Park
snippet_inner_link: Must Read: 10 Haunted Places In Delhi That Will Give You Creeps
snippet_text:
Distance: 157 km

Time: 4 hours

Best time to visit: February to-March

For those looking for a simple yet adventurous getaway, drive to Alwar. The princely city offers an experience of architectural grandeur and heritage hotels.

Further ahead lies one of the most famous Tiger reserves -- Sariska, housing many endangered species.

Tip: Leave early morning at about 4 am and you may reach Sariska by 7 am. The earlier you start your ride in Sariska, the more will be the chances to visit the most haunted place in India -- Bhangarh!

blog_post_title: 12 One Day Road Trips From Delhi-12
h1_tag: 12 One Day Road Trips From Delhi
h2_tag: 12. Road trip to the Royal City of Jaipur
snippet_heading: Road Trip To The Royal City Of Jaipur
snippet_inner_link: Further Read: 30 Reasons I Would Rather Be In Delhi Than Anywhere Else
snippet_text:
Distance: 269 km

Time: 5 hours 30 minutes

Best time to visit: November to February

Dhabas en route:-Surya Dhaba in Alwar district and Old Rao Dhaba in Dharuhera

When it comes to road trips around Delhi, Jaipur falls in the list of must visits! Though the highway is mostly under construction, but leaving in the early hours will help you reach the destination faster. But whats amusing is the drive along the Aravallis, peacock glances on the highway and the fascinating bright turbans visible from a distance.

While on the go stop at Bajwa Ka Dhaba or Highway King or eat at Sharma Dhaba on the Sikar Road.

\n

The city has many marvellous hangouts but for a true Rajasthani experience go straight to Chowki Dhani about 22 km before the Jaipur city.

These destinations will sure not burn a hole in your pocket and will keep you yearning for more. Get high on happiness to visit the local hideouts, call your friends, fill up the fuel and get set go!

-

blog_post_title: 10 Things To Do On Your Mauritius Honeymoon-1
h1_tag: 10 Things To Do On Your Mauritius Honeymoon
snippet_text:
Mauritius honeymoon is incomplete without a mid-night candle-light date on one of the endless white beaches or a blissful time soaking up the sun with your partner. Islands finest beaches like Grand Bay, Pereybere, Belle Mare, and Blue Bay give you all the excuse to cuddle with your partner on the cool sand. Naughty adventure on your mind- Try holding her through a parasailing session or taking her on a fun-filled ski ride.

The best time to visit Mauritius for honeymoon for beach hopping is between April-June and September-December. This lets you skip the abundant rainfall that shows up during February and March.
snippet_content:
Beach-hopping



Image Source

Naughty adventure on your mind- Try holding her through a parasailing session or taking her on a fun-filled ski ride.

blog_post_title: 10 Things To Do On Your Mauritius Honeymoon-2
h1_tag: 10 Things To Do On Your Mauritius Honeymoon
h2_tag: 2. Hire a car: Be your own master
snippet_inner_link: Must Read: Make The Most Of Your Mauritius Trip With These Goof -- Proof Tips
snippet_text: Renting a car is definitely one of the top things to do in Mauritius. The island has an extensive motorway and widespread coastal roads. While taxis could be expensive and time consuming, a car is at your disposal 24/7. Dont miss out on the opportunity to wind through sugarcane plantations, city centre, and markets all at your free will. Take a romantic scenic drive from Pamplemousse towards Pieter Both or down south to Chemin Grenier and Le More. Nothing compares the freedom of driving around with your partner to explore the whole island.

blog_post_title: 10 Things To Do On Your Mauritius Honeymoon-4
h1_tag: 10 Things To Do On Your Mauritius Honeymoon
h2_tag: 4. Food Indulgence : From streets to fine dine
snippet_text: The Mauritian land offers a unique mix of Creole, African, Indian and Chinese influences. Make sure you experience both: street food as well as a romantic fine dinner. The must try from the Mauritian streets is dholl puri served with hot chili paste. The best places to try these are at Dewa & Sons on Rose Hill and Chapeau La Paille in Port Louis. On the other hand some of the top Mauritius hotels and resorts like Oberoi offer in house set up to enjoy a private romantic dinner with your loved one. This saves you the effort of stepping out to look for a romantic reservation.

blog_post_title: 10 Things To Do On Your Mauritius Honeymoon-5
h1_tag: 10 Things To Do On Your Mauritius Honeymoon
h2_tag: 5. Chamarel Village : Home to the Seven Colored Earth
snippet_text:
The little village of Chamarel in South Mauritius is one of the most famous Mauritius attractions. This village is famous for its colored surfaces (result of some geological locchaa) with a mix of purples, yellows, oranges, and reds. The uneven volcanic surface is also home to the highest waterfall in Mauritius. These natural beauties are usually visited as part of a combined trip popularly known as the visit to Seven Colored Earth. Keep this on the top of your list of Places to visit in Mauritius during your Mauritius honeymoon.

Tip: This could be a great place to propose your better-half all over again and make them fall for you!

blog_post_title: 10 Things To Do On Your Mauritius Honeymoon-6
h1_tag: 10 Things To Do On Your Mauritius Honeymoon
snippet_inner_link: Suggested Read: Romance Aboard A Catamaran Cruise On Your Mauritius Honeymoon For Memories Of A Lifetime
snippet_text: A Mauritius attraction you just cannot afford to miss during your Mauritius honeymoon is the Ile aux Cerfs, an island located off the East coast. Popularly known as the Treasure Island, this picturesque getaway is famous for its spectacular white sandy beaches, palm trees and turquoise blue water. You can relax on the beach, prepare a barbeque with your partner, and go parasailing. With array of restaurnts on the island such as the Chez Tino offering the view of the harbor from its terrace, you can as well indulge in some sinful exotic flavors over a romantic meal.

blog_post_title: 10 Things To Do On Your Mauritius Honeymoon-7
h1_tag: 10 Things To Do On Your Mauritius Honeymoon
snippet_text: You simply cant run short of things to do in Mauritius, and relishing a spa treatment definitely tops the chart. The Spa at Four Season Resort Mauritius at Anahita is one place where you will find a mix of Indian, African, Chinese and European therapeutic spas. You and your partner would love to be buffed with their signature Mauritian fusion spas and massage. Its a two -- three hour soothing experience thatll get you started for the forthcoming nights on your Mauritius honeymoon!

h1_tag: 10 Things To Do On Your Mauritius Honeymoon
h2_tag: 8. Pamplemousses Botanical Garden : A Scenic Treat
snippet_text: The southern hemisphere of the island houses one of the oldest of its kind botanical garden. The lush landscape is certainly one of the best places to visit in Mauritius. Explore the variations in species with more than 85 varieties of palm trees and other flora. Apart from the greenery, the fish ponds laid beautifully inside are worth visiting on your Mauritius honeymoon.

blog_post_title: 10 Things To Do On Your Mauritius Honeymoon-9
h1_tag: 10 Things To Do On Your Mauritius Honeymoon
h2_tag: 9. Grand Bassin : its a lake thing
snippet_text: High up in the mountains, almost 1800 feet above sea level, lies a breathtaking lake. The Grand basin is also considered as a sacred lake as per Hindu beliefs. This interesting legend must make a part of your places to visit in Mauritius as it is believed that the waters inside the crater communicates with the waters of holy Ganges of India. Indian connection, yahan bhi-!

blog_post_title: 10 Things To Do On Your Mauritius Honeymoon-10
h1_tag: 10 Things To Do On Your Mauritius Honeymoon
snippet_text:
If you and your partner are heading to Mauritius during summers and enjoy extreme sports then Skydiving has to be one of the things to do in Mauritius. Head to the north east side of the island to experience the spectacular aerial view with approximately 10,000 sq ft skydive. The 360- view of Mauritius will leave you with an unforgettable experience for a lifetime! Not much can be said about this one, its the experience that will count!

Your travel checklist will include:
Tip: Dont forget to click the most bizarre selfies with your love at the Curious Corner of Chamarel.

Mauritius Visa: Indian nationals get a maximum 60-day visa upon arrival to Mauritius. However, you must fulfil the following criteria for this:

  • a confirmed accommodation booking in Mauritius
  • a sponsorship letter
  • a confirmed return flight ticket
  • enough funds to last during their stay in Mauritius (minimum of USD 100 per day)

You can find more details about the eligibility criteria and others details on the IATA website.


Flight Charges: The one-way ticket to Mauritius starts from Rs. 63,000 per person during peak season. However, if you are booking a few months in advance, you will easily get a ticket between Rs. 30,000 and Rs. 35, 000 per person. You can book a ticket for the date of your choice on the Air Mauritius site

Mauritius Honeymoon Package: It is best to avail a package deal. You can find several packages listed here. The basic package starts from INR 58,000/- (per person for 6 nights) and goes up to as high as INR 1,14,000/-

A Romantic Stay in Mauritius
Living in Mauritius is all about luxury. The island has some of the best luxury residences youll find anywhere in the world. Here we list top 5 romantic hotels and resorts in Mauritius:

  • One&Only Le Saint Geran
  • Constance Belle Mare Plage
  • Lux Belle Mare
  • Four Seasons Resort Anahita
  • The Sands Resort

Mauritius Weather: During the summers, from November to May, Mauritius weather is hot, humid and wet. The average temperature ranges between 20- C and 28- C. And if you are near the coast, it may well touch a scorching 30 degrees. Winters though are a bit of a relief. The temperature falls, but not drastically, and you get the much-required relief from the humidity. This makes Mauritius a great winter escape.

Suggested Read: Curepipe In Mauritius: 5 Reasons Why It Is An Unrivalled Getaway

snippet_heading: Scuba Diving, Snorkelling And Underwater Walk In Andamans
snippet_text:
\nAway from the mainland of India, explore the exotic underwater world and untouched beauty of the beautiful Andaman Islands. With azure coloured waters in every direction, Havelock Island is one of the best sites to scuba dive in the country. And if you are not into diving then explore the world with a Sea Walker helmet or snorkelling gear to watch the corals and colourful fish. And definitely indulge in adventure sports like glass bottom boating, water skiing, Para sailing and windsurfing for a memorable holiday.

Further Explore: Top 12 Places To Visit In Andaman

snippet_text: \nWith the backwaters full of touristy houseboats, this is an alternate way to explore Kerala’s backwaters. Starting at Alleppey, paddle together through villages, the narrow canals of Pulinkunnu, island of Kavalam to finally reach Kovilakom. Get a ringside view of the unspoiled and tranquil life along the backwaters as you stay in Heritage Villas. This is a trip, that would give a new twist to the much talked about Kerala holiday.

h2_tag: 7. White River Rafting in Zanskar River
snippet_heading: White River Rafting In Zanskar River
snippet_text:
\nGive the romantic resorts a break and go for an adventurous break in the breathtaking surroundings and remote locations in Ladakh. Follow the Zanskar River, starting from Padum as it merges with the Indus for a mind blowing rafting experience. With the spectacular view of Ladakh, walls of mountains on both sides and beautiful Buddhist monasteries on the horizon, this is the river adventure that mixes extreme adrenaline with extreme beauty.

Further Read: 14 Reasons Why You Should Travel to Himalayas in Your 20 Somethings

h1_tag: 10 Refreshingly Insane Water-Adventures In India For Couples
snippet_text: \nThis one is for you if you are looking for a great river run on a holiday. Starting from Rishikesh, follow the Bhagirathi till its confluence with the Alaknanda at Devprayag for a truly exciting trip. Rush through the dangerous gorges, charming villages and white sandy beaches for a pure white water rafting adventure. This would be a trip that would be hard to forget for a long time to come.

blog_post_title: 10 Refreshingly Insane Water-Adventures In India For Couples-9
h1_tag: 10 Refreshingly Insane Water-Adventures In India For Couples
snippet_text:
\nExperience the euphoria of a rivers life on a dramatic trip with your loved one. Follow the stunning journey of the Mahakali River through the culturally rich region of Kumaon. Watch the dramatic terraced landscape and snow caped peaks as you move towards the end of the rivers journey into the ghats of Tanakpur. In addition, get a glimpse of the rivers prolific birdlife and wildlife like the Red Billed Blue Magpie, the Mountain Goat, Yellow Throated Marten and the Barking deer.

Of course, this is not all. With so many amazing rivers gushing through the landscape of our country, there is a lot more left to explore. Tell us your favourite destinations to get drenched in with your loved ones. We are listening!

blog_post_title: The Ultimate List of Adventure Holidays In India for Summer-2
h1_tag: The Ultimate List of Adventure Holidays In India for Summer
snippet_inner_link: Must Read: 15 Places To Visit In India While You Are Still Young
snippet_text: \nThe unexplored North East has a plethora of retreats to offer to the adventure junkies. Those who arent afraid of heights, darkness, tight spaces and bugs, Caving or Spelunking can prove to be a great sport for you. And Meghalay is a cavers paradise. It has the deepest and longest of caves in the entire South Asia. Mawsmai Caves are popular amongst beginners and tourists. Bat Caves, Krem Phylllut Cave, Krem Lymput, Krem Dam & Krem Mawjymbuin are popular amongst spelunkers.

blog_post_title: 13 Places You Need To Visit For The Best Wildlife Experience in India-0
h1_tag: 13 Places You Need To Visit For The Best Wildlife Experience in India
snippet_text:
This National Park is located in Rajasthan and was previously a famous hunting ground for the Maharajas. Now a wildlife conservation park, this park is most famous for its Tiger trails and Bird watching tours.

How to get there: The Park is three hours drive from Jaipur.

Things to do: Bakula has a lot of waterholes and hence is crowded with wildlife. The Raj Bagh ruins are ancient ruined structures, domes and arches. The Padam Talao is another lake worth visiting. The Ranthambore fort is ideally located. The view from the top is mesmerizing.

Species to see: Tigers, leopards, Hyenas, Jackals, Jungle cats, Indian Foxes and a wide range of birds like Pelicans, Ibis, Flamingos, Egrets, Parakeets

Opening/Closing times: The Park is open from October to June. It is closed for the remaining months of the year. The morning trip is from 6.30 am to 10 am. And the evening trip is from 2.30 pm to 6 pm. The Charges are around Rs. 75 for an Indian national in a canter and Rs. 131 for an Indian national in a gypsy. For foreign nationals it is Rs. 475 in a canter and Rs. 530 in a gypsy.

Where to stay: Taj Sawai, Tree House Anuraga, Tiger Den resort, the tiger villa, Tiger moon resort, Sanctuary resort, Ankur resort

Adventure Tip:-You could soar high in the sky in a hot air balloon for some spectacular views of the National Park.
snippet_content:
Ranthambore National Park, Rajasthan



This National Park is located in Rajasthan and was previously a famous hunting ground for the Maharajas. Now a wildlife conservation park, this park is most famous for its Tiger trails and Bird watching tours.

How to get there: The Park is three hours drive from Jaipur.

Things to do: Bakula has a lot of waterholes and hence is crowded with wildlife. The Raj Bagh ruins are ancient ruined structures, domes and arches. The Padam Talao is another lake worth visiting. The Ranthambore fort is ideally located. The view from the top is mesmerizing.

Species to see: Tigers, leopards, Hyenas, Jackals, Jungle cats, Indian Foxes and a wide range of birds like Pelicans, Ibis, Flamingos, Egrets, Parakeets

Opening/Closing times: The Park is open from October to June. It is closed for the remaining months of the year. The morning trip is from 6.30 am to 10 am. And the evening trip is from 2.30 pm to 6 pm. The Charges are around Rs. 75 for an Indian national in a canter and Rs. 131 for an Indian national in a gypsy. For foreign nationals it is Rs. 475 in a canter and Rs. 530 in a gypsy.

Where to stay: Taj Sawai, Tree House Anuraga, Tiger Den resort, the tiger villa, Tiger moon resort, Sanctuary resort, Ankur resort

Adventure Tip:-You could soar high in the sky in a hot air balloon for some spectacular views of the National Park.

blog_post_title: 13 Places You Need To Visit For The Best Wildlife Experience in India-1
h1_tag: 13 Places You Need To Visit For The Best Wildlife Experience in India
snippet_inner_link: Must Read: Your Long Weekend Travel Calendar for 2015
snippet_text:
It is said that whether you spot a Tiger at Sunderbans or no, it is sure to have spotted you. Sunderbans with its marshy land, dense mangroves and Tigers, is a naturalist’s paradise. Spread over 54 islands, it extends into neighboring Bangladesh.

How to get there: The Park is around 95 kms from Kolkata

Things to do: Go on a Tiger trail, See the various watch towers and the crocodile park

Species to see: The Royal Bengal Tiger, Crocodiles, bull sharks, primates and snakes, dolphins

Opening/Closing times: It is best to visit the park between September and May. Entry fee is Rs. 15 for an Indian and Rs. 150 for a foreigner. An extra charge of Rs. 300 is levied for a camera.

Where to stay: Sunderbans Tiger camp, United 21 Resort

Adventure Tip:-This national park offers a unique experience of cruising in the waters & spotting the wildlife alongside.

blog_post_title: 13 Places You Need To Visit For The Best Wildlife Experience in India-2
h1_tag: 13 Places You Need To Visit For The Best Wildlife Experience in India
snippet_text:
Situated in the mountainous district of Nainital, Jim Corbett National Park which is a part of the larger Corbett Tiger reserve is home to a large number of tigers. If you are lucky, you may spot a white tiger as well.

How to get there: Nainital is around five hours drive from Delhi.

Things to do: Drive around the park to catch a glimpse of the wildlife, try angling at Kosi River, visit the Corbett falls

Species to see: Tigers, Spotted deer, Elephants, Golden jackal, sambar deers

Opening/Closing times: Best to visit the park is from 15th November to 15th June. The Park is open from 6 am to 10 am and then from 2 pm to 6 pm. The Park charges are Rs. 200 for an Indian national and Rs. 1000 for a foreigner.

Where to stay: Aahana The Corbett Wilderness, The river view retreat, The Den Corbett, Le roi Corbett

Adventure Tip: Enter the park with a permit and celebrate a peaceful bonfire night amidst the wilderness.

blog_post_title: 13 Places You Need To Visit For The Best Wildlife Experience in India-3
h1_tag: 13 Places You Need To Visit For The Best Wildlife Experience in India
snippet_text:
The Gir National forest in Gujarat is best known for its Asiatic lions. Gujarat tourism is synonymous with the Gir Lions. If you want to enjoy an exciting safari and catch a good look of the king of the jungle, then head straight to Gir.

How to get there: Junagadh is the closest city to Gir national Park. Junagadh has a railway station that connects it to bigger cities like Ahmedabad

Things to do: Go for the lion safari and get up and close with the king of the jungle, also try boating amongst the many lakes in Gir

Species to see: Asiatic Lions, Indian leopards, sloth bears, jungle cats, striped hyenas, snakes, blackbucks, crocodiles, monitor lizards

Opening/Closing times: The Park is open from 16th October to 15th June every year. The morning timings are from 6 am to 12 pm. and then evening timings are from 3 pm to 6 pm. The Charges are Rs. 4000 for upto 6 Indian Nationals travelling in a jeep. And Rs, 10, 000 for upto 6 foreign nationals travelling by jeep.

Where to stay: Gir Jungle resort, the gateway hotel, Anil farm house, Gir Lion’s paw resort, Hotel Umang
snippet_content:

blog_post_title: 13 Places You Need To Visit For The Best Wildlife Experience in India-4
h1_tag: 13 Places You Need To Visit For The Best Wildlife Experience in India
snippet_text:
Just at the outskirts, south of Bangalore, is the Bannerghatta Biological Park. This park includes a zoo, an elephant sanctuary, a tiger park and a butterfly park. Who would have thought that such a wonderful nature’s treat lies in the middle of a bustling city-

How to get there: The Park is 22 kms from Bengaluru city.

Things to do: Check out the Butterfly Park and go on a tiger safari, also go boating

Species to see: Tigers, leopards, Elephants, spotted deer, barking deers, butterflies, snakes

Opening/Closing times: The Park is closed on Tuesdays. The park opens at 9.30 am and closes at 5 pm. Entry fee for the butterfly park is Rs. 30 for adults and Rs. 20 for children. The grand safari costs Rs. 260 for adults and Rs. 130 for children.

Where to stay: Svenska design hotels, Ibis Bengaluru Hosur road, Confido Inn & Suites, Lords Plaza Bengaluru
snippet_content:

blog_post_title: 13 Places You Need To Visit For The Best Wildlife Experience in India-5
h1_tag: 13 Places You Need To Visit For The Best Wildlife Experience in India
snippet_inner_link: Must Read: 31 Reasons Why You Should Never Visit North East India
snippet_text:
This park has the largest population of one horned Rhino in the World. This national park has achieved great success with its conservation projects.

How to get there: The Park is a five hours drive from Guwahati. Guwahati is connected to most major cities by rail and road

Things to do: Check out the tea plantations around the park Go on a safari to spot rhinos and tigers, Take in a view of the entire park from the watchtowers

Species to see: Tigers, Rhinos, Elephants, Swamp deer, Wild Buffalo

Opening/Closing times: The park is open daily from 1st November to 30th April i.e., for 6 (six) months. Jeep safari timings are from 7.30 am to 9.30 am and 2pm to 3.30 pm. The entry fee is Rs. 50 for an Indian national and Rs. 500 for a foreign national.

Where to stay: IORA- The retreat, Infinity, Aranya Lodge, Jupuri Ghar

Adventure Tip: Explore wildlife while you sail on the glinting waters of the river Brahmaputra.
snippet_content:
Kaziranga National Park, Assam

blog_post_title: 13 Places You Need To Visit For The Best Wildlife Experience in India-6
h1_tag: 13 Places You Need To Visit For The Best Wildlife Experience in India
snippet_text:
This park is in the hilly areas of the Cardamom Hills in Kerala. Perched among the hills, this park is a nature lover’s paradise. With is lush green slopes and landscapes, it is a visual treat.

How to get there: Periyar National Park is a three hours drive from Kochi. Kochi is a well-connected city and has an airport as well

Things to do: The wildlife trail is highly recommended; take a boat ride on the periyar lake, Check out the wildlife sanctuary

Species to see: Elephants, Tigers, Leopards, Deers, snakes and reptiles

Opening/Closing times: The Park is open all days of the week from 6 am to 6 pm. The entry fees is Rs. 25 for an Indian adult and Rs. 5 for an Indian child. And Rs. 300 for an adult foreigner and Rs. 105 for a foreign child.

Where to stay: Springdale heritage, Aranya Nivas KTDC, Spice village, the elephant thekkady

Adventure Tip:-For an unbeatable wildlife experience in one of the most verdant states of India, go bamboo rafting along the river to spectate the richness of flora & fauna.
snippet_content:

h1_tag: 13 Places You Need To Visit For The Best Wildlife Experience in India
snippet_text:
This Park has a large population of tigers and langurs. The park is at the center of India and is home to the famous white tiger.

How to get there: It is not easy to reach Bandhavgarh as it has no airport facility. The nearest town is Jabalpur. There are taxis services which ply from Jabalpur to Umaria

Things to do: Go for a birding tour or a jeep safari to catch a glimpse of the best wildlife. Also once there, do not miss out on seeing the Khajuraho temples. Also have a look at the Bandhavgarh fort.

Species to see: Bengal tigers, Elephants, deers, primates, reptiles and a large number of birds

Opening/Closing times: The Park is open from 15th of October to 30th of June. The entry fees is Rs. 4000 for foreigners and Rs. 2000 for Indian nationals for a jeep carrying up to 6 people.

Where to stay: Bundela Jungle Lodge, Kings Lodge Bandhavgarh, Nature heritage resort, Tiger Lagoon resort
snippet_content:

blog_post_title: 13 Places You Need To Visit For The Best Wildlife Experience in India-8
h1_tag: 13 Places You Need To Visit For The Best Wildlife Experience in India
snippet_text:
This is a high altitude national park in eastern Ladakh in Jammu Kashmir. The park is home to many endangered animals like the snow leopard, the Asiatic Ibex, the red fox, Tibetan wolf. This park has pine forests, meadows and is nothing short of a safari in heaven.

How to get there: The nearest railway station is Kalka in Haryana. The park is 5 kms from the Leh district; the leh-manali highway can also be used to access the park

Things to do: Take an adventure trek at Hemis

Species to see: snow leopard, the Asiatic Ibex, the red fox, Tibetan wolf, Himalayan marmot, Blue sheep

Opening/Closing times: The Park is open on all days. The entry fees is Rs 20 for an Indian national and Rs. 100 for a foreigner.

Where to stay: There are no hotels near Hemis national park. There are villages around the park where homestay facilities are available. The Hemis monastery also provides rooms for visitors to stay
snippet_content:
Hemis National Park, Jammu Kashmir



This is a high altitude national park in eastern Ladakh in Jammu Kashmir. The park is home to many endangered animals like the snow leopard, the Asiatic Ibex, the red fox, Tibetan wolf. This park has pine forests, meadows and is nothing short of a safari in heaven.

How to get there: The nearest railway station is Kalka in Haryana. The park is 5 kms from the Leh district; the leh-manali highway can also be used to access the park

Species to see: snow leopard, the Asiatic Ibex, the red fox, Tibetan wolf, Himalayan marmot, Blue sheep

blog_post_title: 13 Places You Need To Visit For The Best Wildlife Experience in India-9
h1_tag: 13 Places You Need To Visit For The Best Wildlife Experience in India
h2_tag: 10. The Great Himalayan National Park, Himachal Pradesh
snippet_heading: The Great Himalayan National Park, Himachal Pradesh
snippet_text:
This park is in the snowcapped mountain regions of Kullu. With coniferous forests, sloping hills and green landscapes, this park is the crowning glory of the Himalayan slopes.

How to get there: The starting point of the park is at Kullu Valley. Kullu is connected to most major cities by road.

Things to do: Take a walk among the clouds, breathe in fresh pollution free air, go on a trek among the forest lands and take a boat ride on the river Tirthan. Also camp under the stars

Species to see: The snow leopard, musk deer, primates, Himalayan pit viper

Opening/Closing times: The Park is open throughout the year. The entry fees is Rs. 50 for an Indian national and Rs. 200 for a foreign national.

Where to stay: Forest House Saipora which has a dormitory, library and also arranges biodiversity trails
snippet_content:
The Great Himalayan National Park, Himachal Pradesh

snippet_text:
Tadoba is one of the largest national parks in Maharashtra. Very close to the city, Nagpur, Tadoba is most famous for its Tigers and Tadoba crocodiles.

How to get there: The park is very close to the city Nagpur. By rail, the closest railway station is Chandrapur.

Things to do: Go on the tiger safari and bird watching trails

Species to see: The Chimur Hills and Andhari sanctuary

Opeing/Closing times: The park is open from 15th October to 30th June. The park is closed on Tuesdays and the timings are 6 am to 11 am and 3 pm to 6 pm. The entry fee is Rs. 10 for an adult and Rs. 5 for children

Where to stay: Svasara Jungle lodge and resorts, Tuli Tiger resort, The wildflower resort

h1_tag: 13 Places You Need To Visit For The Best Wildlife Experience in India
snippet_text:
Nanda Devi National Park is home to the Asiatic black bear. Adjoining the valley of flowers, Nanda Devi Park is a sight to behold.

How to get there: The nearest railway station is at Rishikesh. By road, the park can be accessed via Joshimath

Things to do: Try and scale the nanda devi peak, Enjoy the views from various hilltops and peaks, Take a walk in the alpine valley

Species to see: Asiatic black bear, blue sheep, Himalayan musk deer

Opening/Closing times: Best time to visit the park is between April and October.

Where to stay: There are very few accommodation options at Nanda Devi. Visitors can tay at hotels in Joshimath and Badrinath.
snippet_content:

snippet_inner_link: Further Explore: 15 Places to visit in India while you are still young
snippet_text:
Famous for the red panda, Tibetan antelopes and snow leopards, this national park gets its name from the Kanchenjunga mountain in Sikkim.

How to get there: The park can be accessed from the city Gangtok.

Things to do: See the many lakes and mountain peaks besides getting a glimpse of the Red Panda

Species to see: Musk deer, snow leopard, red panda

Opening/Closing times: The best time to visit is between April and May. Entry fee is Rs. 200 per head for an Indian national for the first seven days and Rs. 400 per head for a foreign national for the first seven days.

Where to stay: It is advisable to stay at hotels at Gangtok, given that very few accommodation options are available at the Park. Mayfair Spa and Resort, Suhim Portico, Orange Villa Resort
snippet_content:

snippet_text:
Price range (per night): 12,694 – 35,605
Hotel Rating: 5 Star
User Rating (Tripadvisor): 4.5 | View Reviews


There cant be anything more relaxing than the sense of a comfortable stay secluded from the city buzz with great ambience and hospitality. Such is the large, spacious Marari Beach Resort, which has found the first place among the best resorts in Kerala.

Their well-equipped villas and semi--outdoor bathroom adds an awe to the pampering experience. End your trip with morning yoga and meditation led by skilled yogis and indulge in the self-cooking experiences of the local delicacies with the courteous chefs.

h2_tag: 4. Kayaloram Heritage Lake Resort- Unwind amid nature

snippet_text:
Price range (per night): 4,316 – 8,568
Hotel Rating: 3 Star

h2_tag: 3. Jetwing Lighthouse, Galle – Blend of antiquity and modernity
snippet_inner_link: Must Read: 19 Photos that will make you wish you were in Sri Lanka Right Now!
snippet_text:
\nJetwing Lighthouse in Galle is one of the most-elegant and romantic beach resorts in Sri Lanka to enjoy an evening drink at the terrace watching the spectacular sunset. A mix of old world elegance and fantastic amenities, all guest rooms here are provided with a butler service for a perfectly private stay. With access to a wide swath of beach and plenty of rock pools, the hotel provides plenty of opportunities for an ultimate tropical holiday. Dig into the scrumptious cuisine on the poolside bar and grill, go sightseeing nearby and unwind in the steam-room and spa.

Price: US $250 per night
Reviews on TripAdvisor | Resort Website

h1_tag: 10 Romantic Beach Resorts in Sri Lanka to Melt Your Hearts Away
h2_tag: 4. Amanwella, Tangalle – One of best romantic beach resorts in Sri Lanka with plunge pool
snippet_text:
\nAmanwella is one of the best beach resorts in Sri Lanka. It has the perfect location to enjoy the rugged landscape and rich coastal surroundings of Tangalle. With 30 contemporary suites, each with its own plunge pool and terrace, enjoy luxury at its best in this stylish retreat. Modern yet serene, the guests here also have a unique option to observe rare marvels like giant turtles on nearby beaches, elephant herds in national parks and the blue waters of the Indian Ocean. Come here for a memorable weekend full of romance and time alone with your partner.

Price: US $850 per night
Reviews on TripAdvisor | Resort Website

h1_tag: 10 Romantic Beach Resorts in Sri Lanka to Melt Your Hearts Away
h2_tag: 9. Era beach by Jetwing – Incredible Colonial styled bungalows
snippet_text:
\nTake a journey back into the bygone era at Era beach by Jetwing. This colonial style residence features two beautiful bungalows with a serene ambience, a private beach and lush tropical garden that will induce romance and excitement in your holiday. Indulge in the Mediterranean and Asian food at the restaurant, take leisurely swims in the pool or long walks on the beach with your partner for a memorable holiday here.

Price: US $250 per night
Reviews on TripAdvisor | Resort Website

blog_post_title: 10 Romantic Beach Resorts in Sri Lanka to Melt Your Hearts Away-10
h1_tag: 10 Romantic Beach Resorts in Sri Lanka to Melt Your Hearts Away
h2_tag: 10. Serene Pavilions, Wadduwa – Amalgamation of Balinese and Sri Lankan architecture
snippet_inner_link: Further Explore: Food Paradises of Sri Lanka
snippet_text:
\nNumber 10 in our list of most romantic beach resorts in Sri Lanka is Serene Pavilions, Wadduwa. Get lost in the opulent SriLankan and Balinese architecture of this resort. Indulgence at its best, this spacious tropical haven comprises of 12 pavilions, where world class service sit side by side with breathtaking natural beauty. Enjoy your romantic holiday, digging into scrumptious food or wandering on the nearby beach and relaxing in the palm garden as you get served your every need by your private butler.

Price: US $500 per night
Reviews on TripAdvisor | Resort Website

Sri Lanka is the newest place to catch the fancy of the beach loving population of the world. Though it is fast developing, it has still a lot left to be explored by the tourists looking for an uncrowded, intimate holiday.

blog_post_title: Romantic Beach Resorts In India For The Summer Of Love-0
h1_tag: Romantic Beach Resorts In India For The Summer Of Love
h2_tag: 1. Taj Exotica, Goa: For a Romance Tucked Away from Crowd!
snippet_inner_link: Suggested Read: 16 resorts in Kerala you will yearn to be with your sweetheart
snippet_text:
Located on the Southwest Coast of Goa, overlooking the Arabian Sea, the Taj Exotica is a Mediterranean style luxury beach resort property. Spread along 56 acres along Benaulim Beach with the tranquil water of the private beach, you and your partner can unwind in the plush romantic setting. Beautiful landscaping, excellent room service and delicious food, Taj Exotica is easily one of the most romantic and sought after beach destinations for a vacation the both of you will never forget!

  • Popular sightseeing places close to the hotel are Varca beach(6 km), Madgaon City (7.5 miles) and Colva beach(5 km)
  • Tariff: Room with ocean view starting from INR 11,900/-
  • Website

2. The Ramada Caravela Beach Resort, Goa

Romance has all new definition when you book a trip to the Ramada Caravela Beach Resort which will give you an unforgettable experience of the sun, sand and beach. Sunset point in the hotel is the highlight adding charm to the whole sight with your loved one by your side. Perfect plan to relax is sinking into a chair, sipping on a cocktail and watching the beautiful sunset painting the landscape!

  • Some famous places that are situated in close vicinity to the hotel are Varca Beach (2km approx.), Cavelossim Beach (5km), Sernabatim Beach (7km), Fatorda Stadium (9km), Pandit Jawaharlal Nehru Stadium (9km), Sunset Beach (11km), Bogmallo Beach (21km) and Shri Naguesh Temple (22km).
  • Tariff: Ocean Front View Room starting from INR 11,000/-
  • Website

3. The Leela Kempinski, Kovalam: Indulge into Panoramic Romance!


Situated on a cliff, The Leela offers panoramic views of the Kovalam shoreline and the Arabian Sea. The beauty of the resort lies in its private beach and spa. Imagine a vacation staring over the pristine beaches to the far horizon with your loved one: having goose bumps already- Well the Leela Kovalam is Keralas largest beachside resort and of course understands opulence and unstinting luxury like nobody. Dont forget to try cocktails at their Sky Bar while watching the sunset with arms wrapped around your partner.

  • The resort is approximately 9 miles from Trivandrum City and the famous Padmanabhaswamy Temple
  • Tariff: Room with beach view starting from INR 14,500/-
  • Website

4. Vivanta by Taj Fishermans Cove, Chennai : Soak in the spirits of Sea & Love


Built on the ramparts of an Old Dutch Fort, the charming luxury resort comes across as almost one with the Bay of Bengal. From location to service, everything about this place is sure to make the two of you fall in love again! Be prepared to get thoroughly pampered with its renewed cottages & villas, semi-private beach, over the top spa experience and mouth watering cuisines. The resort is located on Covelong Beach in Kancheepuram district.

  • The heritage village of Dakshina Chitra (Approx. 3 km), MGM Dizzee World, Mayajaal Sports Complex and Tiger Cave, a rock-cut Hindu temple complex, The Madras Crocodile Bank Trust are some of the attractions located nearby.
  • Tariff: Room with Sea View starting from INR 9,900/-
  • Website

5. Best Western-Blue Ocean Resort & Spa, Ratnagiri, Maharashtra: Captivating Romance Assured!


Quietly located at Malgund, near Ganpatipule in Ratnagiri district of Maharashtra, the property will greet you with a sense of openness and romance. The shimmering blue coastline, tropically dense premises is inspired from Thai culture. Set in 75 acres, the Best Western Blue Ocean Research & Spa is an abode of peace and luxury. Treat your romance with a sensual experience.

  • Travelers must visit: Ganapatipule Beach (Approx. 5km) and Malgund Beach (Approx. 0.1km). Ganapatipule Virgin Beach for several water sports like motor boats, rowboats, water scooters etc, Ganpatipule Temple, Jaigad Fort and Jaigad Lighthouse.
  • Beach front villa starting from INR 15,730/-
  • Website

Planning your honeymoon but confused about where to go- These honeymoon stories help you find your best honeymoon trip ever!

Real honeymooners. Real stays. Real opinions to help you make the right choice.

6. Mayfair Palm Beach Resort, Ganjam, Orissa

Opt for the rooms with sea facing balconies and you going to experience paradise at the Mayfair Palm Beach Resorts. Located on the Bay of Bengal, enjoy the splendor of the Gopalpur Sea while you take a romantic walk in their beautiful stretches of landscaped gardens. Cherry on the cake is their sunrise and sunset points: take her for a surprise and watch the sun appear or disappear together!

  • The resort is about about a 2-hour drive from Bhubaneswar and approximately 16 km from Berhampore, the commercial hub of Southern Orissa (head out for shopping here)
  • Rooms starting from INR 10,000/-
  • Website

7. Hotel Sea Face, Kovalam, Kerala


Have you ever dreamt of an intimidating vacation while you witness various hues of nature- Well, if no then Hotel Sea Face, Kovalam is an idea beach retreat. Located on the Hava Beach of Kovalam known for its breezy character, the private sit out area facing the Arabian sea is assured to give you a sense of oneness with the waters.

  • Go for activities like catamaran rides, ayurveda massages, lagoon cruises etc.
  • Rooms starting from INR 2400/- during off seasons and INR 4800/- during peak seasons
  • Website

8. Paradise Isle Beach Resort, Udupi, Karnataka


Situated on the Maple Beach, Paradise Isle Beach Resort is one of the best beach resorts in Karnataka. It offers best of the views of the sun, sand and the sea. Indulge in the magic as the sun makes the off-white sands and silver waters sparkle and allow your love strings to attach anew. The night view when the whole landscape of the sky and water gets painted blue is also a sight you would not want to miss!

  • Prominent tourist attractions like Kaup Beach, Shree Krishna Temple and St. Mary’s Islands are situated few kilometers away from the resort.
  • Sea view rooms starting from INR 5500/-
  • Website

9. The Radisson Blu Temple Bay Beach Resort, Mahabalipuram


The aesthetic landscape of palm trees rising from blue lagoons is a sight that will make your romantic trip here completely worthwhile. The spectacular vision of the inviting beach and the 44 acres of tropical land set against the Bay of Bengal, is going to keep you hooked to your loved one in the lap of tropical nature.

  • Places that can be explored during the stay : Shore Temple (700 m approx.), Arjuna’s Penance (750 m approx.), Krishna Mandapam (800 m approx.)
  • Rooms starting from INR 9500/-
  • Website

10. Cherai Beach Resorts, Cochin, Kerala : Oasis of Beauty


The resort offers the best of both worlds with a beach in the front and the backwaters behind. If you are planning a date trip to Kerala, this is one place which will help satisfy all your Kerala lust. Sit and laze about enjoying the fascinating greenery all around.

  • Hot spots in the city : Gowreeswara Temple (Approx. 2km), St. Mary’s Orthodox Syrian Church (Approx. 3km), Santhanagopala – Krishnaswamy Temple, Vamanamoorthy temple, Bolghatty Palace and Hill Palace Museum.
  • Villas starting from INR 9000/- onwards
  • Website

11. The Barefoot at Havelock Resort, Andaman and Nicobar Islands


Set amidst dense tropical forests on the infamous beach No. 7, the Barefoot at Havelock Resort will charm you forever. Staying in one of the 25 lavishly designed and decorated tents, cottages and villas, this resort overlooks green foliage which lets you unearth the treasures of nature with your partner. You may also want to explore the enchanting views hidden underwater, as you go for scuba dive at Barefoot, the first and only PADI 5 Star Instructor Development Resort in the Andaman Islands.

  • Places to Explore in the Vicinity: The Cellular Jail National Memorial, famous for its sound & light show; Mahatma Gandhi Marine National Park; Chidiya Tapu; Viper Island
  • Rooms starting from Rs. 6500 onwards
  • Website

These natural wonders are equally modish and can make anyone go weak in the knees. And if you are with your partner, the stay at these resorts becomes even more exotic. So pack your bags and surprise your better half with this once in a lifetime vacation experience.

Indulge in the magic as the sun makes the off-white sands and silver waters sparkle and allow your love strings to attach anew. The night view when the whole landscape of the sky and water gets painted blue is also a sight you would not want to miss!

  • Prominent tourist attractions like Kaup Beach, Shree Krishna Temple and St. Mary’s Islands are situated few kilometers away from the resort.
  • Sea view rooms starting from INR 5500/-

These natural wonders are equally modish and can make anyone go weak in the knees. And if you are with your partner, the stay at these resorts becomes even more exotic. So pack your bags and surprise your better half with this once in a lifetime vacation experience.

Further Read: 10 Romantic Resorts In India That Assure Gorgeous Settings, Utmost Privacy, & Unmatched Comfort
snippet_text:
Set amidst dense tropical forests on the infamous beach No. 7, the Barefoot at Havelock Resort will charm you forever. Staying in one of the 25 lavishly designed and decorated tents, cottages and villas, this resort overlooks green foliage which lets you unearth the treasures of nature with your partner. You may also want to explore the enchanting views hidden underwater, as you go for scuba dive at Barefoot, the first and only PADI 5 Star Instructor Development Resort in the Andaman Islands.

  • Places to Explore in the Vicinity: The Cellular Jail National Memorial, famous for its sound & light show; Mahatma Gandhi Marine National Park; Chidiya Tapu; Viper Island
  • Rooms starting from Rs. 6500 onwards
  • Website

blog_post_title: 10 Resorts in The Hills of India with the most Romantic Views-0
h1_tag: 10 Resorts in The Hills of India with the most Romantic Views
snippet_text:
\nPlaced at a vantage point for an absolutely stunning vistas of the mountains and pines, The Khyber Resort is an ideal setting for a holiday extravaganza. Set in a semi-circle around a valley situated in the Pir Panjal range, it has one set of rooms facing the snow-covered Apharwat range and another facing the town of Gulmarg. Carved walnut panels, teak panelled floors, traditionally embroidered bed covers and the classic Kashmiri woven silk carpets gives this classic mountain cabin an upscale edge. When here, enjoy the delectable Kashmiri cuisine, spend a relaxing afternoon at the spa, warm up in the cigar lounge and of course visit the famous Gondola.

Tariff: INR 17,000 per night
snippet_content:
The Khyber Resort, Gulmarg



Image Source

blog_post_title: 10 Resorts in The Hills of India with the most Romantic Views-2
h1_tag: 10 Resorts in The Hills of India with the most Romantic Views
snippet_text:
\nPerched on the Kumaon Himalayas and providing a glamorous and unbroken view of the mountains and the surrounding forests, the Nandadevi Estate is the perfect place for an intimate holiday. Be enamoured by the beautiful hills on the wide verandas as you curl up in front of the open fireplace and sip on a glass of wine. Also, get the hotel to arrange outdoor activities for some uninterrupted time together. Camp overnight in the forest, go horse-riding along the centuries-old trails, or make a trip to Almora to visit the ancient Nanda Devi temple.

Tariff: INR 19,000 per night

Nandadevi Estate, Binsar



Image Source

snippet_text:
\nDating back nearly 100 years, The Oberoi Cecil is beautiful heritage hotel that combines the British grandeur with the majestic view of the surrounding himalayan ranges and cedar forests. Get mesmerised by the colonial atmosphere, wooden period furniture, regal pillars, striking chandeliers and grand fireplaces. Pamper yourself with a visit to the spa, take a dip in the indoor pool and relax at the Tea lounge and Bar for a perfect day with your loved one.

Tariff: INR 15,000 per night

blog_post_title: 10 Resorts in The Hills of India with the most Romantic Views-4
h1_tag: 10 Resorts in The Hills of India with the most Romantic Views
snippet_text:
\nWith a truly spectacular view of the mighty Kanchenjunga and the lush green tea estates, Glenburn Tea Estate should be your stay of choice in Darjeeling. Spend a romantic holiday with your partner in this idyllic resort complete with lavish colonial style suites and lodges on the banks of the River Teesta. Each of the 8 suites have a distinct ambience, with access to the gardens, verandahs and the terraces. Enjoy a personalised dinner by the fire from vegetables plucked from the organic garden, freshly plucked bed-tea in the morning and get lost in the sumptuous Victorian ambience for a memorable holiday.

Tariff: INR 30,000 per night

Glenburn Tea Estate, Darjeeling

blog_post_title: 10 Resorts in The Hills of India with the most Romantic Views-6
h1_tag: 10 Resorts in The Hills of India with the most Romantic Views
snippet_text:
\nSet amidst the rugged Western Ghats, Banasura Hill Resort is a heady mix of contemporary kitsch and Kerala-style architecture. Located amidst the tropical rainforest it has mud-rooms built by the local tribals for naturally cool environment. Indulge in an Ayurvedic treatment at the Banasura Ayur Spa, tour with naturalists available at the resort and interact with local tribes and spot a meandering wild elephant. Sip into the fragrant Chukku Kaapi, and enjoy the intimate and romantic ambience of the log huts, twin villas or earth rooms for a superb holiday with your significant other.

Tariff: INR 10,000 per night
snippet_content:
Banasura Hill Resort, Wayanad



Image Source

blog_post_title: 10 Resorts in The Hills of India with the most Romantic Views-7
h1_tag: 10 Resorts in The Hills of India with the most Romantic Views
snippet_text:
\nSet against the backdrop of the enchanting Khasi Hills and overlooking the serene Umiam Lake, Ri Kynjai blends together luxurious service and idyllic nature. Inspired from the original Khasi thatch huts, the resort is made from bamboo and red pine local stones. Take a walk around the resort, through the tall pine groves along a waterfront to the paddy fields, a small organic tea and vegetable garden. Also indulge in the traditional Khasi treatments at the Khem Janai spa with your partner for a memorable trip.

Tariff: INR 11,000 per night
snippet_content:
Ri Kynjai, Shillong



Image Source

You can relax and marvel at the monument of love, The Taj Mahal, while sitting in the lap of luxury at The Oberoi Amarvilas. History states that the labourers who built the Taj Mahal had to cut of their arms so that the monuments beauty could remain unparalleled. You could also marvel at the fact that it would cost you an arm and a leg to stay a night here. Make that two arms and a leg! Ironic, Isnt it-

With today’s high paced world of deals, mergers and acquisitions, youd think Shahjehan were receiving a loyalty fee -- uh make that royalty fee!

Kohinoor Suite: 7,50,000.00
Luxury Suite: 5,00,000.00
Delux luxury taj mahal view: 3,00,000.00
Delux Suite: 2,00,000.00

h1_tag: 9 Most Romantic Mauritius Honeymoon Beach Resorts
snippet_inner_link:
Must Read: 18 kickass destinations which greet Indians with a Visa On Arrival. Lets just Leave

Mauritius is a visa free destinations for South Africans. Indian nationals get a maximum 60-day visa on arrival to Mauritius. For more details you could visit IATA website
snippet_text:
For the newlyweds who seek solace post the hectic wedding days, Lakaz Chamarel is an idyllic honeymoon hideaway for you. Pebbles inscribed with inspirational words, statues of deities in the lovely garden and the bohemian vibe makes it a whimsical resort of all.

Where- Piton Canot, Chamarel, Mauritius

Whats Special- Located at an altitude of 400m in undulating green hills, this charismatic resort is where honeymooners come to unplug and unwind.

Dont Miss: Take a slow walk hand-in-hand with your love to the tranquil pristine beaches and watch the sunset change the sky into myriads of peaches & corals.

Suggested Room: Opt for the sea-view rooms with spectacular vista & low lighting; adorned discreetly to preserve a sexy mystery between the lovers.

Things to do: Refresh your senses with a yoga session at the resort and unwind at the white shores & picturesque backdrops, with your precious half as your see the day pass by.

Tariff: -156 to -323 | INR 12,758 – 23,774

Hotel Website | Ratings & Reviews

Decided on your romantic stay- Now heres what all you need in your travel checklist:

Mauritius Visa: You must fulfil the following criteria in order to avail a Mauritius Visa:

  • A confirmed accommodation booking in Mauritius
  • A sponsorship letter
  • enough funds to last during your stay in Mauritius [a minimum of $100 a day]
  • A Confirmed return flight ticket

Mauritius is a visa free destinations for South Africans. Indian nationals get a maximum 60-day visa on arrival to Mauritius. For more details you could visit IATA website.

Flight tickets: It always helps if you plan in advance and book your flight tickets. A one way ticket three months in advance on Air Mauritius site would cost from INR 30,000 – INR 35,000. If you happen to plan on an urgent basis, one way ticket may cost upto INR 65,000
Best time to visit: Mauritius is a perfect escape for winters. The best time for a romantic honeymoon in Mauritius would be from October to March.

Important: It is advisable to carry your marriage certificate while on a honeymoon in Mauritius. Many hotels & resorts require your marriage certificate to be not more than 12 months old in order to receive complimentary honeymoon services.

Explore Memorable Honeymoon Packages in and outside India!

snippet_text:
\nElevated 2000 feet above Hyderabad, this luxurious 5-star property features a blend of colonial and Indian designs with the aim of giving the full 19th-century experience. Guests here experience the famed Nizam’s hospitality which was once the sole preserve of the royalty.

Special Features:
\nThis lavish palace hotel has 60 uniquely distinct rooms furnished with floral fabrics, fine wood fittings and Egyptian cotton linen. The magnificent oak-panelled, palace library, is a replica of the library at Windsor Castle and encloses rare manuscripts.

The palace boasts of the rich heritage walks with beautifully crafted objects from the world over; Mughal, Rajasthani and Japanese gardens personally conceived by the Nizam and the grand dining rooms.

Tariff: INR 33,000 – INR 1,75,000
Hotel Website

The hotel offers specialised dining experiences & romantic settings with spectacular views from balconies & terraces.

Tip: Do not miss a ride in the vintage horse driven carriage at the Umaid Bhawan Palace.

Known as the Jewel of Jaipur, Rambagh Palace is a luxurious hotel with beautiful Indian architecture. Veiled in 19 hectares of expansive, ornamental gardens, the hotel rooms have a fantastic views across the immaculate lawns and Mughal Terrace.

Unique features:
Every room and suite reflects the world of royalty with exquisite antiques, rich tapestries and paintings. Exclusive royal butlers assist the guests in historical introduction to the palace, setup private dinners and shopping excursions in Jaipur. The refreshing tented Jiva Grande Spa offers traditional Indian rejuvenation therapies.
The vintage hotel boasts of rides in old Pontiac (1939), Ford (1936), Plymoth (1937) and vintage horse-drawn carriage.

Taj Rambagh Palace, Jaipur



Image Source


Known as the Jewel of Jaipur, Rambagh Palace is a luxurious hotel with beautiful Indian architecture. Veiled in 19 hectares of expansive, ornamental gardens, the hotel rooms have a fantastic views across the immaculate lawns and Mughal Terrace.

Unique features:
Every room and suite reflects the world of royalty with exquisite antiques, rich tapestries and paintings. Exclusive royal butlers assist the guests in historical introduction to the palace, setup private dinners and shopping excursions in Jaipur. The refreshing tented Jiva Grande Spa offers traditional Indian rejuvenation therapies.
The vintage hotel boasts of rides in old Pontiac (1939), Ford (1936), Plymoth (1937) and vintage horse-drawn carriage.

Tariff: INR 23,500 – INR 4,00,000
Hotel Website

snippet_inner_link: Must Read: 13 Places You Need To Visit Fo The Best Wildlife Experience in India
snippet_text: \nThe Little Rann of Kutch is a salt marsh and little visited sanctuary for the endangered Asiatic wild ass, and a good place to spot birdlife including flamingos. This eco camp features a few comfortable but simple Kooba (mud huts) with bathrooms but no electricity. Its run by Devjibhai Dhamecha, a knowledgeable naturalist who has fought hard for the conservation of the area, and his family. As always the home-cooked food is a highlight.

blog_post_title: 10 Best Winter Honeymoon Destinations In India-0
h1_tag: 10 Best Winter Honeymoon Destinations In India
snippet_text:
Daman and Diu are small islands in the southern tip of Gujarat. A honeymoon in this sparsely populated union territory is always a blissful blend of the sun, sea and sand which makes it the best among the winter honeymoon destinations in India.

Best honeymoon experiences: Stroll along the cliffs with your partner; cycle around the island; explore the town and its maze of alleys; walk along the beaches of Nagao; go caving; make a wish in the churches; explore the Diu fort and left overs of Portuguese culture and people.
To get here: Fly to Diu Airport, nearest railway station is Vapi
Ideal honeymoon stay in winters: 10 to 15 days
Best time to visit for a winter honeymoon: November to February
Land Packages: Start from INR 15,000
Hotels for a romantic stay: The Deltin Hotel & Casino; Sugati Beach Resort; Radhika Resort; The Gold Beach Resort; Hotel Kohinoor, Kostamar Beach Resort
