blog_post_title: 10 Best Winter Honeymoon Destinations In India-1
h1_tag: 10 Best Winter Honeymoon Destinations In India
snippet_text:
A fairytale rising from the mirage of a long lost royalty, Jaisalmer is for those who wish to celebrate their love amidst art and culture. Royal forts to sand dunes -- everything is equally enriching.

Best honeymoon experiences:-Go for a desert safari, camping and bonfire among the sand dunes; feel the warmth of royal love in the quaint havelis, forts and palaces; celebrate your love amidst the festivals, folk music, dance, arts and craft of this mesmerizing winter honeymoon destinations in India.
To get here: Jodhpur is the closest domestic airport. The city is well connected by trains from almost every part of India, including the glorious Palace on Wheelsa special luxury train run by The Indian Railways.
Ideal honeymoon stay in winters: 6 to 7 days
Best time to visit for winter honeymoon: October to March
Land packages: Starting from INR 7,000
Hotels for a romantic stay: Hotel Fifu; Hotel Pleasant Haveli; The Desert Resort; Hotel Victoria; Khuri Desert Resort; Suryagarh

snippet_text:
Beach beauty, ain’t it- When everything looks beautiful around you, Goa is the most ideal destination for a classy honeymoon in Indian winters.

Best honeymoon experiences: Camp around and go for a bonfire at the secluded beaches; go for a night out in Goa on a cruise or a floating tent; shop till you drop at the Saturday night market on Anjuna road, indulge in the thrilling watersports in Goa and gamble at some floating casinos with your new found lucky charm.
To get here: Fly to Dabolim Airport near Panjim; major railheads in Goa are Madgaon and Thivim.
Ideal honeymoon stay in winters: 5 to 10 days
Best time to visit for winter honeymoon: October to January
Land Packages: Starting from INR 15,000
Hotels for a romantic stay: Panchavatti Guest House Retreat; Taj Exotica; Pousada Tauma; Fort Tiracol Heritage Hotel; Park Hyatt Goa Resort and Spa

blog_post_title: 10 Best Winter Honeymoon Destinations In India-4
h1_tag: 10 Best Winter Honeymoon Destinations In India
snippet_inner_link: Suggested Read: 5 Best Romantic Honeymoon Resorts In Munnar Handpicked For A Perfect Memory
snippet_text:
Tea plantations, misty mountains and luxurious resorts. These two gems in the Gods own country--Kerala, boast of some of the most ideal winter honeymoon experiences, amidst their ayurvedic ambience.

Best honeymoon experiences: Explore the serenity of Tea plantations, enjoy a romantic walk on the sands of the Western Ghats; go for a safari to Eravikulam National Park and hike along the exotic wildlife in the hills; go for backwater cruises in Kerala on a houseboat in Alleppey.
To get here: Cochin is the nearest airport; the closest railway station--Aluva, is 110 kms away.
Ideal honeymoon stay in winters: 5 to 6 days
Best time to visit for winter honeymoon: October to March
Land Packages: Starting from INR 8,000
Hotels for a romantic stay: Wild Elephant Resort, KTDC Tea County, Windermere Estate, Blackberry Hills Retreat and Spa, Tea Valley Resort, Deshadan Mountain Resort are some of the best options in Munnar; and in -Alleppey, Kayaloram Lake Resort, Prince Hotel and Coir Village Lake Resort are the ideal ones.

blog_post_title: 10 Best Winter Honeymoon Destinations In India-6
h1_tag: 10 Best Winter Honeymoon Destinations In India
snippet_inner_link: Suggested Read: 7 Scenic Tourist Places In Darjeeling
snippet_text:
The rustic charm of this hill station can beat the ass of any other romantic destination in the world. Come winters and the hazy days through the lush green panorama will force you to plant that kiss youve been longing to. Your list of honeymoon places in India in winter is pretty much empty without Darjeeling’s mention.

Best honeymoon experiences: Explore the beautiful lush greens of the tea plantations; trek along with your better half, hike to the mountains, have a birds eye view of the Himalayan heights and Khangchendzonga panorama from Mall road; make love in the surreal warmth of the hills. Dont forget to take a ride on the heritage toy train.
To get here: Land at Bagdogra Airport, located 96 km away from Darjeeling; nearest railhead is New Jalpaiguri
Ideal honeymoon stay in winters: 5 to 7 days
Best time to visit for winter honeymoon: November to February
Land Packages: Starting from INR 8,000
Hotels for a romantic stay: Dekeling Hotel; Elgin Darjeeling; Sinclairs Darjeeling; Glenburn Tea Estate; Mayfair Darjeeling; Windermere Hotel; Cedar Inn,

These twin sisters in the Himalayas are the most scenic snow princesses up north. The snow clad hills offer some of the most adventurous honeymooners escape, making it among best honeymoon places in India in winter.

Best honeymoon experiences: Indulge in Heli skiing, snow skiing, ice skating while it snows the best in Manali; trek to the heights of Dhauladhar and Pir Panjal ranges, go for river rafting in the waters of Beas, paraglide with your partner and dare the skies; laze around in the awesome caf- culture while you go shopping on Mall road.
To get here: Land at Bhuntar airport, drive from nearby cities like Delhi and Chandigarh.
Ideal honeymoon stay in winters:-3 to 4 days
Best time to visit for winter honeymoon: November to February
Land Packages: -Starting from INR 6,000

blog_post_title: 10 Best Winter Honeymoon Destinations In India-8
h1_tag: 10 Best Winter Honeymoon Destinations In India
snippet_inner_link: Suggested Read: 10 Fascinating Spots In Shimla You Need To Visit Right Now
snippet_text:
The queen of hills has her own charms. A kullad chai in the snow clad lanes, shopping in the lakkad bazaar, hiking up the hills to soak in the chills of cold breeze, Shimla offers you every chance to look back at your love and admire each other. This is one of loveliest honeymoon places in India in December, mainly because of the magical snowfall that’s anticipated during the end of the month.

Best honeymoon experiences: Track back your footprints at the snow clad Scandal Point, explore Mall road, Lakkar Bazaar and five benches road while you walk hand in hand with your new found love; go for skiing and ice skating in Kufri; walk to the Summer hills or enjoy a ride on the heritage toy train.
To get here: 23 km away from Shimla, Jubarhati is the nearest airport and Kalka is the nearest railway station
Ideal honeymoon stay in winters: 2 to 3 days
Best time to visit for winter honeymoon: November to March
Land Packages: Starts from INR 5000
Hotels for a romantic stay: The Oberoi Cecil, Shilon Resort, East Bourne Resort & Spa, Radisson Hotel Shimla, Woodville Palace

blog_post_title: 10 Best Winter Honeymoon Destinations In India-9
h1_tag: 10 Best Winter Honeymoon Destinations In India
snippet_text:
A honeymoon in paradise itself! No comparisons, no metaphors. Ladies and gentlemen, we present to you our very own SwitzerlandJammu and Kashmir.

Best honeymoon experiences: Skiing starts at Gulmarg in December; thus, this honeymoon destination in India is a must on your list. Laze around in a houseboat and soak in the panoramic beauty of snow clad Himalayas in Dal Lake, explore the Mughal Gardens and frozen lakes, learn preparing Kashmiri Wazwan, shop around for woolen and pashmina.
To get here: Fly to Srinagar International Airport from any part of India; nearest railway station is at Udhampur in Jammu.
Ideal honeymoon stay during winters: 5 to 8 days
Best time to visit for honeymoon in winters: November to January
Land Packages: Start from INR 10,000
Best hotels to stay for honeymoon: Heevan Resort, Mirani Resorts, Vivanta Dal View Srinagar by Taj, The Lalit Grand Palace Srinagar, Jamal Resorts, Hotel Dar-Es-Salam

Here ends our list of the best honeymoon destinations in India in winters.-Read up these commonly asked questions, so you have a clearer view regarding Indian honeymoon destinations:-

An electrifying performance on the streets is something to look out for. Youngsters start preparing for this day from before so that they can live every bit of it. Make it to Pondicherry this time at New Years to make the most memorable time.

blog_post_title: 15 Places In India To Celebrate New Year 2018-10
h1_tag: 15 Places In India To Celebrate New Year 2018
snippet_text:
Known across the world for its regal charm, Jaipur is without a doubt one of the best places in India to celebrate new year. When here, you can welcome the new year in so many ways. If you feel like diving into the local heritage, you can spend the new years eve at Choki Dhani, witnessing cultural performances and eating delicious Rajasthani cuisine.

There are various pubs in Jaipur that organize happening new year bashes. And if you want to feel like the maharajas, there is always so many royal resorts and hotels in Jaipur like the ITC Rajputana that offer the best of hospitality and world-class amenities.

  • Explore the secluded caves in Old Goa
  • Buy souvenirs from Flea Markets

  • Enjoy Sea food and Goanese cuisine
  • Dont forget to take a hit of their local liquor, Fenny

blog_post_title: 20 Must Visit Places When Travelling to the North East-0
h1_tag: 20 Must Visit Places When Travelling to the North East
h2_tag: 1. Be with one-horned rhinoceros at Kaziranga National Park
snippet_heading: Be With One-horned Rhinoceros At Kaziranga National Park
snippet_text:
Declared a UNESCO Heritage Site, the National Park is home to the one horned rhinos which attract tourists from all over the world. Spotting a one-horned rhinoceros in its stomping yard is an experience that you can live to tell your grandchildren. It will be unlike any lore ever told.
Famous for: The one horned rhinoceros.
No. of species: 35 species of mammals and hundreds of migratory birds species that fly down every season.

Famous for: The one horned rhinoceros.
No. of species: 35 species of mammals and hundreds of migratory birds species that fly down every season.

blog_post_title: 20 Must Visit Places When Travelling to the North East-1
h1_tag: 20 Must Visit Places When Travelling to the North East
h2_tag: 2. Largest Monastery in India, Tawang Monastery
snippet_heading: Largest Monastery In India, Tawang Monastery
snippet_text:
[fx-photo-tag id=”tawang-monastery”]


\nSituated at a height of 10,000 feet in Arunachal Pradesh, it gives a breath-taking view of the valley.
Best Time to Visit: It is best to visit this valley from April to October.
How to reach: You can reach Tawang by trains, buses, helicopters, flights and road. But if you want to enjoy some exquisite views during the course of your journey it is best to travel via a flight to Tezpur and then take a bus from there to Tawang. You can more details on the Tawang official website.
Famous For: It is famous for its celestial beauty in the night, and you should plan to visit it on the night of a full moon. It has around 850 sculptures to admire.

blog_post_title: 20 Must Visit Places When Travelling to the North East-3
h1_tag: 20 Must Visit Places When Travelling to the North East
h2_tag: 4. Echoing Experience at Nathu La Pass
snippet_heading: Echoing Experience At Nathu La Pass
snippet_text:
[fx-photo-tag id=”nathula-pass”]


\nThe name of the pass translates to listening ears. The trek on the Nathu La pass gives an invigorating feeling to every person. You are treated to the views that remain ingrained in your memory for a lifetime, and you get to spot some beautiful lakes on the way.
Best time to visit: You should plan your visit during the summers, when the temperatures are at a bearable 15 degrees. In the winters, it falls down to -25 degrees.
Important consideration: Do not rush into anything. The cold temperature and low oxygen level makes for a hostile environment. Move gradually and take baby steps if required.

blog_post_title: 20 Must Visit Places When Travelling to the North East-4
h1_tag: 20 Must Visit Places When Travelling to the North East
snippet_text:
[fx-photo-tag id=”siang-river-rafting”]


\nA tributary of the Brahmaputra River, it has inherited its ferocity from its mother as well. It serves as a home to the Adi Tribe of Arunachal Pradesh. River rafting in the Siang River is a major attraction. It is certainly one adventure that you should undertake with your friends. The thrill of the Grade III and Grade IV rivers make it worth it.
Best time: The best time to visit is during late October and early November when the tides are not too violent.

h1_tag: 20 Must Visit Places When Travelling to the North East
snippet_text:
The Gorichen Peak is located at 6,500 meters above sea level. It is still considered to be one of the more climbable peaks. Imagine the beauty of the scenes and the ecstasy you feel when youve scaled this huge mountain.
Best Time to Climb: Summers is the best time to undertake this trek.
Where to stay: It is nearest to Tawang, and the guest houses there are quite decent. During the trek to the summit, youll have to set up camp.
Activities: You can undertake various activities like camping, trekking and even rock climbing. The trek to the summit is best undertaken by seasoned climbers.

h1_tag: 20 Must Visit Places When Travelling to the North East
snippet_text:
\nThe highest peak of the Sikkim-West Bengal border, Sandakphu peaks at over 11,000 above sea level. The feeling of reaching the summit is that of accomplishment. It is a boost to the confidence as the Khangchendzonga watches over from the distance.
Best time to visit: The place is open for tourists year round, but the best time to visit is during springs (April -- May). You can also try going there in November, when the weather is pleasant.
Famous for: The unmatched view of all the peaks in the Himalayan range.

h2_tag: 12. Experience Serenity and Peace at the Phodong Monastery
snippet_heading: Experience Serenity And Peace At The Phodong Monastery
snippet_text:
\nThe monastery dates back to the 18th century, and is one of the most religious for the Kagyu sect of Buddhists. There are indications that the structure dates back even more than 18th century, with the secluded location making it even more wonderful to experience.
Famous For: Reconstruction and apparent existence of an older monastery. You can also find some ancient murals at the place.

blog_post_title: 20 Must Visit Places When Travelling to the North East-12
h1_tag: 20 Must Visit Places When Travelling to the North East
h2_tag: 13. Spend Some Time in Solace at Ravangla
snippet_heading: Spend Some Time In Solace At Ravangla
snippet_text:
\nA tourist attraction in the southern part of Sikkim, this little town is a recluse for anyone who is looking for one. It lets you stand alone in a crowd, surrounded by the serenity of the flowers in the summer and the snow-clad peaks in the winters. The birdwatchers have a merry time with the Himalayan migratory birds.
Best Time to Visit: The place is at its best during April to June and September to January.
Famous For: Bird watching at the Ralang Monastery which just 6km from the place. It is also famous for the view of all the majestic peaks during sun rise. It also has hot springs which are worth a visit.

Spend Some Time In Solace At Ravangla

blog_post_title: 20 Must Visit Places When Travelling to the North East-17
h1_tag: 20 Must Visit Places When Travelling to the North East
h2_tag: 18. Visit the Majuli Islands before they Vanish!
snippet_heading: Visit The Majuli Islands Before They Vanish!
snippet_text:
\nThe river island is situated in the mighty Brahmaputra. It is a cultural hub of the region, with a number of tribes calling it their home. The size of the island was originally 1200 sq. km. but has come down to just 420 sq. km. due to erosion from the Brahmaputra.
Best time to Visit: It can be visited anytime during the year, but November is the time when people look forward to paying a visit to these islands.
Famous For: Navigation through the fields on a canoe. A variety of birds. An otherworldly experience that you wont find anywhere else.
\nAny concerns- The islands of Majuli are being eroded by the Brahmaputra every year. They might last only a couple of years more. Visit them while they are still on the map!

Visit The Majuli Islands Before They Vanish!



Image Source

blog_post_title: 20 Must Visit Places When Travelling to the North East-19
h1_tag: 20 Must Visit Places When Travelling to the North East
h2_tag: 20. Want Your Dose of Weirdness- Visit the Shilloi Lake
snippet_heading: Want Your Dose Of Weirdness- Visit The Shilloi Lake
snippet_inner_link: Further Explore: 31 Reasons Why You Should Never Visit North East India
snippet_text:
\nIt is one of the highlights of the state of Nagaland. Situated in the town of , it is looked over by some glorious mountain peaks. The lake has an interesting story and custom associated with it, and the surroundings are just as interesting.

blog_post_title: 13 Places In India You Must Visit With Your Family-4
h1_tag: 13 Places In India You Must Visit With Your Family
snippet_inner_link:
Must Read: 10 travel tips you need to know before visiting Himachal Pradesh

Need help with planning your tour- TravelTriangle could help!
snippet_text:
Travelling with family and planning to miss the state, you could lose out on a lot! Right from river rafting to trekking expeditions to scenic landscapes, Himachal is an apt choice for a traveller with kids. Soak yourself in the mild sunlight and breathe the fresh Himalayan breeze while your kids go paragliding, mountaineering, jeep safari and more.

Must Visit:
– Manali and Rohtang Pass for snow clad mountains
– Shimla for the scenic beauty
– McLeodganj for trekking trails
– Kufri for Yak rides
– Solang Valley for adventure sports

Tip: Avoid trekking trips with children below 10 years and elderly. Temperature at Rohtang Pass is usually very low, hence heavy woollen clothing is advised.
Best time to visit: In Spring, April -- June and In winters, November to February

Need help with planning your tour- TravelTriangle could help!

– Chittorgarh for the treasure trove of Rajputana history
– Jaipur for exquisite handicrafts

snippet_text:
The once known Kaalapani is now a popular tourist destination. The tropical environment, white sandy beaches and coral reefs, lush green rainforests and active volcano make a trip to Andaman an adventurous and mesmerizing one.

Must Visit:
– Havelock Islands for Scuba Diving
– Cellular Jail for the light and sound show
– Andaman water sports complex for sea water swimming and more water sport activities

Tip: Avoid locations with high tribal density. Nicobar Islands are out for bound of tourism activities because a majority of tribes reside there.

Best time to visit: Mid November to April

blog_post_title: 13 Places In India You Must Visit With Your Family-9
h1_tag: 13 Places In India You Must Visit With Your Family
snippet_text:
Planning a religious-fun family tour this year- Haridwar and Rishikesh is the place for your family! Visit one of the most holy cities of India and bathe in the Ganges, wash your sins away. Walk on the swaying Laxman Jhula with your kids and travel to Rishikesh for some adventure.

Must Visit:
– Mansa Devi temple in Haridwar
– Laxman Jhula -- the swaying bridge
– Rishikesh for adventure sports
– Har-ki-pauri Ghat for the evening Maha Aarti

Tip: Theres no alcohol or non-vegetarian food available in the holy city. If you cant deal with a strict vegetarian diet, you might not enjoy the place.

Best time to visit: February -- June, August – October

blog_post_title: 13 Places In India You Must Visit With Your Family-11
h1_tag: 13 Places In India You Must Visit With Your Family
snippet_text:
Nestled amidst seven lush valleys of Uttarakhand, Naini lake is believed to be found by Tri-Rishi (lake of three sages) and was explored by the Britishers as a holiday getaway spot. Located about three hours away from Nainital, Jim Corbett is a popular wildlife resort. Over 70,000 tourists visit the national park all-round the year.

Must Visit:
– Naini lake for a peaceful boat ride
– Govind Ballabh Pant Zoo for Siberian tiger, wolves, hill fox and more
– Tiffin top for a panoramic view of Himalayas
– Stop by and have fresh bhuttas on the way
– Jim Corbett for an adventurous wildlife tour

Tip: Thrill yourself with a stay in the jungle at the wildlife resort within the parks premises and you might even get to see a tiger!

Best time to visit:
Nainital: March -- June and September to November
Jim Corbett National Park: November – June

blog_post_title: 13 Places In India You Must Visit With Your Family-12
h1_tag: 13 Places In India You Must Visit With Your Family
snippet_text:
Varanasi or Banaras, is the oldest city of the world. Located by the ghats of the holy river Ganga, the city is a must visit for a splendid religious experience. Symbolizing spiritualism, philosophy & mysticism for thousands of years, Varanasi hypnotizes the tourists with its magical chants and echoing aartis.

Must Visit:
– Jnana Vapi or the Well of wisdom believed to have been dug by Lord Shiva himself
– Boat ride along the Ganges river for the real Banaras experience
– Kashi Vishwanath temple for its gold plated towers
– Ramnagar Fort for its museum displaying vintage cars, royal palkis and more
– Banaras Emporium to buy your wife or your mom the Banarasi Silk Sari

Tip: This city of temples, gallies and ghats will lure you to explore more. Plan your destinations according to the time youll have.

Best time to visit: October -- March

blog_post_title: 13 Places In India You Must Visit With Your Family-13
h1_tag: 13 Places In India You Must Visit With Your Family
h2_tag: 11. Mumbai – the city that never sleeps
snippet_text:
Home to most of the Bollywood celebrities, Mumbai, the city of dreams, literally never sleeps. Be it the mandis preparing for early morning customers or marine drive for a walk by the see any time, places near Mumbai attracts tourists like crazy.

Must Visit:
– Siddhi Vinayak Mandir to witness the religious madness of the city toward Lord Ganesha
– Gateway of India for the view of the majestic Taj, by the sea and ferry rides
– Bandra for a great street shopping experience and stop by at Band Stand, in front for Shah Rukh Khans residence Mannat for a peaceful seaside time.
– Juhu for its choupati consisting of tapris serving lip smacking chaats, pani puri or pav bhaji.
– You may also wish to travel to Lonavala, Shirdi and Nashik. Plan your travel wisely.

Tip: If youre travelling to Mumbai in summers, you may not enjoy much, due to high humidity levels.

Best time to visit: September to March

This beautiful city mostly remains untouched throughout the year until the Jagannath Yatra begins. The city welcomes you with a cool breeze even on the most summery days and the majestic temple adds an aura of peace to your leisure travel.

Must Visit:
– Walk by the beach and enjoy the calmness amidst the noisy atmosphere
– Explore the local shops selling alluring age old arts and artefacts
– Chilka Lake for the biggest salt water lagoon and migratory birds
– Sun Temple at Konark for its magnificent architecture

Tip: If you wish to attend the Rath Yatra festival plan your trip for the months of June-July

Best time to visit: August to March

blog_post_title: 13 Places In India You Must Visit With Your Family-16
h1_tag: 13 Places In India You Must Visit With Your Family
snippet_text:
Located in the Western ghats, Coorg is locally known as the Kashmir of Karnataka. With over three wildlife sanctuaries and one national park, gorgeous sunset points, waterfalls and plenty of coffee plantations, Coorg makes an ideal getaway with family.

Must Visit:
– Rajas seat for a gorgeous sunset view
– Coorgs most popular waterfalls -- Abbey Falls
– Bylakuppe near Kushalanagar is one of the largest Tibetan settlements in south India

Tip: In winters, the temperature can drop below 8 degrees. Hence, woollen clothing is advisable.

Best time to visit: October to June
snippet_content:
Coorg

blog_post_title: 13 Places In India You Must Visit With Your Family-17
h1_tag: 13 Places In India You Must Visit With Your Family
snippet_text:
One of the most popular hill stations of south, Ooty has been referred to as the queen of hill stations, since ages because of its breath taking kaleidoscopic visual treats and soul stirring experiences. Lush green well maintained lawns, rare flora species, tranquil atmosphere are some highlights of this picturesque destination

Must Visit:
– Botanical Garden for a 20 million year old fossilized tree
– Lake Garden by for the fibreglass dome
– High altitude deer parks of India

Tip: In winters the temperature might drop down to 5 degrees or less and hence, woollens are recommended.

blog_post_title: 13 Places In India You Must Visit With Your Family-18
h1_tag: 13 Places In India You Must Visit With Your Family
snippet_text:
The mighty rocks, bowers, creeks, long stretches of forests and the meadows define the charm of Kodaikanal. This princess of hill stations has started gaining popularity recently and offers a perfect getaway resort from the city bustles.

Must Visit:
– Climb to the jutting rocks of Kodai and the Pillar rocks for a delighting view
– Coakers walk for thrilling views
– Telescope House for the panoramic view of the valley

Tip: Children are advised to walk carefully on steep trails.

Best time to visit Kashmir of South India: In Spring, April to June; In Winters, September -- November

blog_post_title: 10 Best Holiday Destinations In South Africa-0
h1_tag: 10 Best Holiday Destinations In South Africa
h2_tag: Best Beach Holiday Destinations In South Africa
h3_tag: 1. Cape Town, Western Cape: The all-in-one cosmopolitan
snippet_text:
Undoubtedly, the best holiday destination in South Africa, Capetown is renowned as one of the most beautiful cities in the world. It is an awesome package of stunning scenery and adventure, mixed with a great lifestyle and a cosmopolitan culture. Hiking at Table Mountain, enjoying the white sandy beaches, tasting the finest wine at the Cape Winelands, all this and more explains why it is among the must visit-destinations in South Africa!

Dont Miss: Wildlife Safari, cable-car ride, whale watching, hiking, wineland tour, & Garden Route Tour

Ideal For: Everyone!

Suggested Stay: Holiday Inn Express, The Table Bay Hotel, & Taj Cape Town

Fun Fact: Did you know you can find Penguins at the Boulders Beach in Cape Town- Thats right folks! Penguins. In Cape Town. And you always thought youd have to go all the way to Antarctica to find these cute & cuddly creatures.

blog_post_title: 10 Best Holiday Destinations In South Africa-2

h2_tag: Best Beach Holiday Destinations In South Africa
h3_tag: 3. Port Elizabeth: The beaches and the Nelson Mandela Bay
snippet_text:
A beach destination in South Africa doesn’t get better than this! Port Elizabeth, rated as a city having the fourth best weather amongst all the coastal cities in the world invites every beach bum to its pristine shores and promises adventures like fishing, surfing, scuba diving and snorkelling. The city is majorly known for its peoples devotion towards the legend Nelson Mandela, as is significant enough from all architecture, along with the city name itself, named after him!

Dont Miss: The beaches (of course), historical centres, water sports, & famous museums

Ideal for: Beach bums, history lovers, & Nelson Mandela fans

Suggested Stay: Radisson Blu, Courtyard Hotel, & 5th Avenue Beach House

Fun Fact: The city has some of the friendliest folk in the country, because of which it is called the Friendly City. Apart from making memories, be sure to make a lot of friends!

blog_post_title: 10 Best Holiday Destinations In South Africa-3
h1_tag: 10 Best Holiday Destinations In South Africa
h2_tag: Most Popular Wildlife Destinations In South Africa
snippet_inner_link: Must Read: 69 Super Sexy Honeymoon Destinations In The World Where You Would Want To Get It On
snippet_text:
Housing various nature and hiking treks and a huge share of the worlds vegetation, Mpumalanga is among the best places to visit in South Africa. The subtropical climate, abundant sunshine and lush covered hills and valleys make the city ideal for visiting. Besides this, Mpumalanga, formerly called Nelspruit, also houses one of the most popular attractions in South Africa- the Kruger National Park, the countrys premier Big Five national park.

Dont Miss: Skydiving, skateboarding, the botanical gardens, grass and wetlands, caves and canyons, and the Kruger Park

Ideal for: Ecology lovers, kids and families, & wildlife photographers

Suggested Stay: La Villa Vita Nelspruit, Sheppard Boutique Hotel, & Mercure Nelspruit

Traveller’s Tip: It is quite unsafe to walk around the city after dark, especially if youre not in a closed vehicle.

Literally meaning Place of Safety, Polokwane is South Africas wildlife and gaming hub, hosting a horde of nature reserves, biodiversity parks and casinos. The interesting differences of the city ranging from-eco-adventure landscapes-to-glittering nightlife for all party animals, and the caves of the oldest fossils on the planet together make Limpopo one of the best holiday destinations in South Africa.

Ideal for: Wildlife fanatics, birdwatchers, adventure freaks, & kids and families

blog_post_title: 10 Best Holiday Destinations In South Africa-5
h1_tag: 10 Best Holiday Destinations In South Africa
h2_tag: Most Popular Wildlife Destinations In South Africa
h3_tag: 6. Bloemfontein, Free State: Roses and Cheetahs…
snippet_text:
\nThe city of roses, as it is most fondly called, courtesy of the blooming flora of roses and the Annual Rose Festival, is one of the most clean, hospitable and peaceful cities in the world. Bloemfontein is known for its hearty, stress-free atmosphere and the Cheetah Experience. The city houses a zoo, the Orchid House botanical garden, Franklin Nature Reserve, the Cheetah Reserve, museums, art galleries, and Windmill Casino. It is the best place to visit in South Africa for all those looking to relax and unwind over their holiday.

Dont Miss: History and art museums, Cheetah experience, wildlife estates, botanical gardens, and the Annual Rose Festival that takes place every year in October (if possible).

Ideal for: Everyone looking for an escape from monotony!

Suggestive Stay: Southern Sun Bloemfontein, The Golf Lodge, & Villa Bali Boutique Hotel

blog_post_title: 10 Best Holiday Destinations In South Africa-6
h1_tag: 10 Best Holiday Destinations In South Africa
h3_tag: 7. Johannesburg, Gauteng: Serious in the day and wild at night
snippet_text:
Joburg is the entertainment hub of the country that offers visitors a once-in-a-lifetime experience, making it one of the best holiday places in South Africa. The city has everything ones looking for, from delightful restaurants, shiny hopping malls, green spaces, exciting casinos, museums and monuments to a glamorous nightlife. The city offers everything, be it business opportunities, a cultural encounter, an adrenaline rush or peace and relaxation. This cultural and urban mix puts it on the top in the list of must see places in South Africa.

Dont Miss: An awesome array of cultural shows, nightlife hotspots, casinos, & shopping centres

Ideal For: Cultural buffs, party animals, night crawlers, & corporate tourists

Suggested Stay: Hyatt Regency, The Michelangelo, & InterContinental Johannesburg Airport Sun

A trip to South Africa is incomplete without visiting this metro and experiencing its quaint, laid-back atmosphere. The city isnt merely a hub of the countrys political activities but features a number of natural and cultural attractions like the Voortrekker Monument, the Austin Roberts Bird Sanctuary, botanical and zoological gardens, entertainment centres like the South African State Theatre, and a glitzy nightlife.

Dont Miss: The political architecture, historical monuments and museums, nature reserves, & zoos

Ideal for: History geeks, peace-lovers, family & kids, intellectuals, & night crawlers

Suggested Stay: Protea Fire & Ice, Illyria House, & Faircity Roodevallei

Pretoria, Gauteng



The citys landscapes are laden with a sea of Jacaranda trees, making it appear purple from above. A trip to South Africa is incomplete without visiting this metro and experiencing its quaint, laid-back atmosphere. The city isnt merely a hub of the countrys political activities but features a number of natural and cultural attractions like the Voortrekker Monument, the Austin Roberts Bird Sanctuary, botanical and zoological gardens, entertainment centres like the South African State Theatre, and a glitzy nightlife.

Dont Miss: The political architecture, historical monuments and museums, nature reserves, & zoos

Ideal for: History geeks, peace-lovers, family & kids, intellectuals, & night crawlers

Suggested Stay: Protea Fire & Ice, Illyria House, & Faircity Roodevallei

blog_post_title: 10 Best Holiday Destinations In South Africa-8
h1_tag: 10 Best Holiday Destinations In South Africa
h3_tag: 9. Kimberley, Northern Cape: The city that sparkles!
snippet_text:
Kimberley, for sure, has had one glittering past! Renowned as the Diamond Capital of the World, the city houses the biggest mining crater ever made by human hands- the Big Hole, that descends 840m below the surface of the earth and is one of the best places to visit in South Africa. The architecture and historical venues, the dominating diamond dynasty, prominent art, and the famous wars that took place in the city, make it one of the most ideal holiday places in South Africa, especially for history lovers.

Dont Miss: The Big Hole, Kimberley Mine Museum, art galleries, Magersfontein Battlefield, & shopping at diamond jewelry stores

Ideal for: History buffs, art lovers, & couples

Suggested Stay: Bell-lu Guest House, Horseshoe Inn, & Taung Tusk Hotel and Casino

Tip: Dont forget to take back a sparkling momento of your trip from one of the citys finest crafted jewelry stores.

blog_post_title: 11 Spectacular Switzerland Tourist Attractions-0
h1_tag: 11 Spectacular Switzerland Tourist Attractions
snippet_text:
\nA turquoise blue lake surrounded by mountains, covered bridges, frescoed historic buildings, waterfront promenades, and sun-splashed plazas, a car-free medieval old town, with bubbling fountains -- Lucerne is the perfect name to start the list of Switzerland tourist attractions. It hosts music festivals and concerts like a few in the world. From Archaeology to history and entertainment to infotainment, Lucerne is a complete package.

Major attractions: Chapel Bridge, Lion monument, annual-International music festival, Swiss Transport museum-with extensive exhibits on all forms of transport, including railroad locomotive.
snippet_content:
Lucerne



Image Source

It hosts music festivals and concerts like a few in the world. From Archaeology to history and entertainment to infotainment, Lucerne is a complete package.

Major attractions: Chapel Bridge, Lion monument, annual-International music festival, Swiss Transport museum-with extensive exhibits on all forms of transport, including railroad locomotive.

snippet_text:
\nInterlaken rests between Lake Thun to the west and Lake Brienz to the east. This beautiful city-hosts some of the best summer holiday resorts in Switzerland. H-hematte, a marvel of urban planning with 35 acres of open space boasts of flower gardens, hotels, and caf-s in the middle of the town and provide for scenic vistas to be framed in memories forever.

Major attractions: Railways, ski lifts, chairlifts and cable cars; snowboarding, cross country skiing, paragliding over snow, paddle steamer cruise around the lakes

blog_post_title: 11 Spectacular Switzerland Tourist Attractions-2
h1_tag: 11 Spectacular Switzerland Tourist Attractions
snippet_text:
\nJungfraujoch hosts of the UNESCO World heritage site of Great Aletsch Glacier, beautiful train journeys to the Bernese Oberland and an enriching observation terrace with a scientific observatory. While the Great Aletsch Glacier is the longest in Europe, the train journey is one of the unique experiences on rails in Europe. It is also a base for famous treks to the surrounding mountains and houses some of the oldest of Swiss resorts in history.

Major attractions: The scenic beauties, walks till Panorama Way to the sunny, south-facing First slope; the Gletscherschlucht (Glacier Gorge); and -pfelch-echliw-g -- the high-altitude trail from Holenstein to Brandegg through fields of flowers, alpine pastures, and woodlands
snippet_content:
-jungfraujoch



Image Source

h1_tag: 11 Spectacular Switzerland Tourist Attractions
snippet_text:
\nEurope’s largest Alpine lake -- Lake Geneva lies on the Swiss/French border. The UN city lies between snow-capped peaks with promenades, parks, and gardens that surround the lake. The old town has its own rustic charm that makes it a lovely spot to stroll among the historic buildings.

Major attractions: The pristine lake, gardens, Opera House, Grand Theatre, cute cafes, and the Montreux Jazz Festival-in June/July

blog_post_title: 11 Spectacular Switzerland Tourist Attractions-4
h1_tag: 11 Spectacular Switzerland Tourist Attractions
snippet_inner_link: Suggested Read: 10 Best Ski Resorts In Switzerland
snippet_text:
\nMatterhorn -- the iconic Swiss peak hosts the charming village of-Zermatt, a top international resort with horse-drawn carriage rides, quaint chalets, and world-class restaurants and hotels. Sharing the border with Italy, the peak is 4,478 meters high, and the four steep faces of the peak lie in the direction of the compass points. What is striking is that the village has banned motored vehicle to preserve the air quality and peaceful ambiance.

Major attractions: Skiing in winters on a slope of 300 kilometers, swimming and tennis as well as hiking, biking, and climbing in the surrounding mountains
snippet_content:
-the Matterhorn



Image Source

h1_tag: 11 Spectacular Switzerland Tourist Attractions
snippet_text:
\nThe Swiss National Park, founded in 1914, is one of the oldest reserves in the Alps of Engadine Valley. Spread over 170 sq km of pine forest in the mountains, it invites nature lovers to explore the wildlife of more than 5,000 species including marmot, red deer, chamois, ibex, and fox.

Major attractions: Flower-dotted hollows, shrubs and streams, limestone crags, mountain treks

By the shores of Lake Geneva-lies Chateau de Chillon (Chillon Castle) which has inspired artists for centuries. The complex encompasses about 25 buildings clustered around three courtyards.

Major attractions: The gothic underground rooms, heritage architecture, great halls, the-Chapel adorned with 14th-century paintings and several medieval murals

snippet_text:
\nCrystal clear lakes, glaciers, snow washed peaks, alpine forests, and days full of sunshine -- St Moritz is one of the world’s top mountain destinations. Having hosted two winter Olympics, the small town overlooks the turquoise Lake of St Moritz.

Major attractions: Health resorts, lake, hiking, biking, glacier skiing, skating and snowboarding, bobsledding and tobogganing on the famous 1.2 km long Cresta run.

snippet_text:

Stretching almost 7 km on Whitsunday island, the chances of it being overcrowded is minimal. Numerous lagoons and coves make this magical beach all the more alluring.

Monkey Mia beach, about 25 km from Denham is popular for dolphin sightings. It is located in the Shark Bay world heritage area. For about 50 years now, bottlenose dolphins visit the shallow waters on this beach and interacting with them is one of the most amazing experiences.

Famous for: Dolphin encounters

Attractions: Water sporting activities

Best time to visit: All the year round

Location: Denham, Western Australia

snippet_text:
One of the oldest, most renowned and sacred temples in Nepal, the Pashupati Nath Temple is located on the fringes of Kathmandu, the capital city of Nepal. River Bagmati flows close to this temple dedicated to Lord Shiva. Ardent Hindu followers visit this tourist place in Nepal to gain the blessings of the divine deity.

Key attractions: Golden Spire of the temple, silver sheeted doors, Panch Deval Complex, and the lingams

When to visit: 4 am -- 12 noon, 6 pm -- 7 pm
snippet_content:
Pashupati Nath Temple

blog_post_title: 9 Most Popular Tourist Places In Nepal-1
h1_tag: 9 Most Popular Tourist Places In Nepal
snippet_text:
Located 7 km northeast of Kathmandu, Boudhanath is a prominent pilgrimage center and one of the most popular tourist places in Nepal. Local as well as Tibetan pilgrimages visit this spiritual place for meditation. It’s a magnificent Stupa that attracts a large number of visitors from far and wide places!

Key attractions: 29 Tibetan Gompas, delightful momos and thupkas, and the prayer wheel

When to visit: Open for the whole day!

Boudanath

snippet_text:
\nThis name in the list of best beaches in Malaysia is also known as ‘the jewel of the Borneo Banks’. Off the mystical island of Borneo, and about 300 km northwest of Kota Kinabalu in Sabah, lies this magnificent creation of Malaysian Navy. Shining like a sparkle within the deep blue sea, the beach hosts of a diving school and airstrip.

Famous for: Scuba diving, deep sea diving, parasailing, and gliding
Travel Alert: -You cannot plan a visit to this beautiful island at your ease as Layang Layang Island Resort is closed from September till February-since the area is plagued by the monsoon during this time.

blog_post_title: 10 Blissful Beaches In Malaysia-5
h1_tag: 10 Blissful Beaches In Malaysia
snippet_text:
\nAlso known as the Monkey beach, Teluk Duyung is one of the most secluded Malaysian beaches and is a part of Penang National Park. It can be entered through the jungle trek, from the Penang national park or by boat. If you go by boat you can book one from Teluk Bahang. Its mandatory that the visitors register at Teluk Bahang to get a permit to enter Teluk Duyung.

Famous for: Wildlife safari, and vivid marine life in the park.
snippet_content:
Teluk Duyung, Penang

blog_post_title: 10 Blissful Beaches In Malaysia-6
h1_tag: 10 Blissful Beaches In Malaysia
snippet_text:
\nAlso known as Battleship island because of its distinctive shape, this idyllic pocket-sized atoll lies in the Celebes Sea. Sibuyan islands is devoid of any resorts or any facilities and this beauty among the Malaysian beaches is inhabited by sea gypsies-and nomadic families. It is usually covered as a part of day trip while visiting neighboring islands. It can be reached in an hour by a speedboat from the Semporna transit point. One can also reach Sibu by a charter flight although we suggest speedboat.

Famous for: Cluster of scenic islands, photography, and turtle spotting
snippet_content:

blog_post_title: 10 Blissful Beaches In Malaysia-7

snippet_inner_link: Suggested Read: 9 Romantic Honeymoon Resorts In Malaysia Right Out Of Your Dream
snippet_text:
\nMabul Island is a small island off the southeastern coast of Sabah, located about 30-45 minutes from the coastal town of Semporna. Ranked among the ten best marine biodiversity sites in the world, Mabul Island is one of the best destinations for muck diving. It also boasts one of the worlds most concentrated reserves of small marine life. And on top of all, the iconic island has plenty of options for accommodation ranging from a budget hostel-to a lavish 4-star water village resort.

Famous for: Muck diving, underwater photography, village hopping, and diving

snippet_text:
\nSipadan island is a legend among scuba divers and its considered a privilege to get a glimpse of the diverse bio- life here. Its so popular that numbers have been limited to 100 visitors per day and there is a waiting list just to see one of the great marine wonders of the world.It takes a 55-minute flight from Kota Kinabalu to the town of Tawau, an hours drive to the even smaller township of Semporna, and then a 40-minute speedboat ride to reach Sipadan.

Famous for: Scuba diving, deep sea diving, snorkeling, and kayaking

blog_post_title: 10 Enchanting Honeymoon Destinations In South Africa-0
h1_tag: 10 Enchanting Honeymoon Destinations In South Africa
snippet_text:
Franschhoek is a beautiful place on the southern slope, nothing short of a lovers alpine retreat. The quaint town is set in the winelands and is reminiscent of provincial France. The secluded terrace resorts, almost at the peaking valley, are covered with strawberry like bougainvillea. The peace and the charm of the town makes it the best honeymoon destination in South Africa.

Romantic experiences: Vintage cars Franschhoek Motor Museum, vineyards walk with fine wine, and romantic ride at Franschhoek wine tram.
Romantic stays: La Residence, The Last Word Franschhoek, The Garden House, and Plumwood Inn
Best time to visit: September to November
snippet_content:
Franschhoek, Cape Town

snippet_text:
Kwazulu Natal is the perfect destination to feel pampered after a hectic wedding schedule. For couples looking for relaxation, it is the best honeymoon getaway in South Africa. Breath in the fresh air in the arms of your spouse & get disconnected from the world. It is achingly romantic to enjoy a glass of wine at sunset, cuddling and gazing into nothingness of the wild. The variety of seafood is an added attraction.

Romantic experiences: Gaming at the game lodge, soaking in tranquility at Nottingham road, Beverly hills, and the upmarket at Oyster Box

snippet_text:
Honeymoon in Limpopo offers you the perfect set-up for beach walks as well as adventurous safaris. It is a home of beautifully carved ancient kingdoms, sacred forests and rain queens. If you are an adventurous couple, the wetlands and the Kruger Safari in Limpopo will not leave you disappointed. Posing with wildlife and gazing at colorful birds promises an awesome honeymoon in South Africa for the wild souls.

Romantic experiences:Immerse yourself in local waters of Bela Bela, Kruger National Park and the safari, Pafuri camp, and romantic outlooks at Vena land near the Zimbabwean Border
Romantic stays: Fairview Hotel and Village, Marataba Safari Lodge, Bushveld Terrace Hotel, and Goranga Safari Camp
Best time to visit: October to March

blog_post_title: 10 Enchanting Honeymoon Destinations In South Africa-6
h1_tag: 10 Enchanting Honeymoon Destinations In South Africa
h2_tag: 7. Free State, Heart of South Africa
snippet_heading: Free State, Heart Of South Africa
snippet_inner_link: Suggested Read: 10 Handpicked Resorts In South Africa
snippet_text:
It is almost 3000 feet above sea level, surrounded by awe-inspiring mountains. A hot one amongst the most beautiful South African honeymoon destinations, Free State charms with its soaring peaks -- snowcapped during winters, sheer cliffs, deep gorges, crystal clear streams and green hills -- make for the perfect recipe for honeymoon.

Romantic experiences: Drive from Johannesburg to Free State, a horse ride at the sunset time at Golden Gate Highlands, Village of Clarens, and the Rose festival
Romantic stays: Castle in Clarens, Moolmonshoek Country Lodge, Fouriesburg Country Inn, and Black Mountain Leisure
Best time to visit: March to July

blog_post_title: 10 Enchanting Honeymoon Destinations In South Africa-7
h1_tag: 10 Enchanting Honeymoon Destinations In South Africa
snippet_text:
Dullstroom is known as Gem of Mpumalanga, and is clearly one of the most romantic destinations in South Africa. It is close to panorama route area featuring magnificent views of landscapes such as the Cayon, Pilgrims rest and Echo caves. Fly fishing, farm atmosphere, still lakes and fresh air give you company in your private moments. You can spend hours with your partner watching the beautiful landscapes and living your dream of an exotic-honeymoon in South Africa.

Romantic experiences: Sadvana Caves exploration, a visit to Lone Creek Falls, shopping in Blue mall, and a visit to Sabi Sand reserves
Romantic stays: Belgrace Boutique Hotel, Badgerluer Bush Lodge, Highgrove House, and Ulusaba Private Game Lodge
Best time to visit: May to August
snippet_content:
Dullstroom, Mpumalanga Province



Image Source

snippet_text:

The vigor and adventure in the town with its gorgeous coral reefs and marine life will drive you crazy. The amalgamation of romance and adventure makes it an amazing spot for honeymoon in South Africa.

Romantic stays: Windermere hotel, Singa Lodge, Radisson Blu, and The Beach Hotel
Best time to visit: April to December

blog_post_title: 12 Weird, Strange-As-Fiction Islands Of The World-0
h1_tag: 12 Weird, Strange-As-Fiction Islands Of The World
h2_tag: 1. Rapa Nui or Easter Island, Chile
snippet_heading: Rapa Nui Or Easter Island, Chile
snippet_text:
\n

\n

Littered all over the island, there are 887 strange statues, over 3 stories tall, famous as Moia statues. And they weigh crazy 14 tons and measure huge 13 feet! Strange is the question of how did early Polynesian inhabitants accomplish such monumental task with their fairly primitive tools. They had no carriages or cranes to pick and drop the large stones out of which the statues are carved.

There is no answer though.
snippet_content:
Rapa Nui Or Easter Island, Chile



Image Source

blog_post_title: 12 Weird, Strange-As-Fiction Islands Of The World-1
h1_tag: 12 Weird, Strange-As-Fiction Islands Of The World
h2_tag: 2. Ilha de Queimada Grande or Snake Island, Brazil
snippet_heading: Ilha De Queimada Grande Or Snake Island, Brazil
snippet_text:
Ohk, think of venom, so powerful that its single drop is capable of melting human flesh. Now think of a snake which is full of such venom. Now, about an island full of just these snakes.

Scary, right- Yes, Snake island is full of 5000 Golden Lanceheads, one of the most dangerous and venomous snakes in the world. These snakes slurp and surf the island like kings as they are the sole inhabitants of the island, sparing a tourist or two, here and there.
snippet_content:

While others claim them to be somehow descended from the heaven to pay homage to the original lot. Quite strange, eh-

h2_tag: 8. La Isla de las Mu-ecas or The Island of the Dolls, Mexico City
snippet_heading: La Isla De Las Mu-ecas Or The Island Of The Dolls, Mexico City
snippet_text:
The former resident of the island, Don Julian, used to claim that a little girl had drowned in the back canals of the island, whom he failed to save. Since that day, various dolls and dismantled body parts of dolls started washing ashore to the island.

Now now, thousands of dolls, hanging from trees or various objects, some mangled, some wrapped in cobwebs, some with body parts missing, some just beheaded!

blog_post_title: 12 Weird, Strange-As-Fiction Islands Of The World-9
h1_tag: 12 Weird, Strange-As-Fiction Islands Of The World
h2_tag: 10. Christmas Island, Australian territory in Indian Ocean
snippet_heading: Christmas Island, Australian Territory In Indian Ocean
snippet_text: The island is named so, as it was discovered on Christmas day in 1643. Populating the island are 14 species of crabs, who scramble to leave their inland burrows during the rainy season to spawn in the sea. Nearly 140 million crabs make this month long treacherous five mile journey to the ocean, albeit all the hurdles of dehydration, dangerous plains, squashing under the vehicles and crazy herds of yellow ants.
snippet_content:
Christmas Island, Australian Territory In Indian Ocean



Image Source

Locals use these islands as settlements to avoid disruptions with neighboring tribes regarding the territories.

Also known as Golden Fort, this majestic fort is made up of yellow sandstone that reflects golden hues and hence gets the name. Raja Jaisal constructed this fort, which is a fine epitome of Rajasthani architectural style and a must visit name among the places to see in Jaisalmer.
Key attractions: 99 turrets of the fort, magnificent look of the fort during night!
Opening hours: Early morning till 5 pm
Entry fee: INR 50 for domestic, INR 250 for others

snippet_text:

Here, not only the nobles, but the cremation of their families also took place.The heritage stories make it a popular name among the places to visit in Jaisalmer.
Key attractions: Mesmerizing sunset and enchanting sunrise.
Opening hours: 8 am to 6 pm
Entry fee: INR 20 for domestic, INR 50 for others

blog_post_title: 10 Glorious Places To Visit In Jaisalmer-3
h1_tag: 10 Glorious Places To Visit In Jaisalmer
snippet_text:
With a roof in the form of a peacock, the entrance of this haveli exudes of tuskers made of sand stones guarding the structure. Slightly different from the other similar architectures of the contemporary times, the haveli has its own artistry. It is also known as Jahaz Mahal as the front of the haveli resembles a ship stern.
Key attractions: The architecture in itself, 38 balconies to lose the track of time and space, elephant structure at the entrance.
Opening hours: 8 am to 5 pm

blog_post_title: 6 Picturesque Destinations For Honeymoon In Bhutan-0
h1_tag: 6 Picturesque Destinations For Honeymoon In Bhutan
snippet_inner_link: Suggested Read: Reasons Why You Lose A Lifetime Travel Experience If You Miss Out Bhutan
snippet_text:
One of the most historic valleys of the country, Paro Valley is a must-visit place on your Bhutan honeymoon trip. Being the center of trade and invasion by the Tibetans, the valley has the closest cultural connection with Tibet vis---vis any other district in Bhutan. The boutique villas facing the beautiful pine forest valley make it an important Bhutan honeymoon destination.

Key attractions: \t Taktshang Tigers Nest monastery, the oldest temple of Kyichu Lhakhang, Drukgyel Dzong, view of the pine-forested valley, the massive fortress of Rinpung Dzong, and the National Museum of Bhutan

Best places to stay: \tUma by COMO, Amankora, and Zhiwa Ling

Best time to visit: \tMarch -- April and October -- November

blog_post_title: 5 Most Haunted Places In Shimla: Exploring The Eerie Side-0
h1_tag: 5 Most Haunted Places In Shimla: Exploring The Eerie Side
snippet_inner_link: Suggested Read: 25 Most Haunted Places In India
snippet_text:
\nClearly topping the list of most haunted places in Shimla is Tunnel 33. British engineer Captain Barog was assigned the responsibility for constructing this tunnel enroute Shimla Kalka Highway. He failed to complete the task assigned and was thus humiliated and penalised by the supervisors. Out of frustration and defame, Barog committed suicide.

Locals believe that spirit of Captain Barog still roams in the tunnel. Many people have also seen a woman walking along the rail track and disappearing gradually.
snippet_content:
Tunnel 33, Barog



Image Source

He failed to complete the task assigned and was thus humiliated and penalised by the supervisors. Out of frustration and defame, Barog committed suicide.

Locals believe that spirit of Captain Barog still roams in the tunnel. Many people have also seen a woman walking along the rail track and disappearing gradually.

blog_post_title: 5 Most Haunted Places In Shimla: Exploring The Eerie Side-1
h1_tag: 5 Most Haunted Places In Shimla: Exploring The Eerie Side
snippet_inner_link: Suggested Read: 7 Haunted Hotels In India
snippet_text:
\nCharleville Mansion is a century-old deserted castle, built in the British era. Located up the lush green hills of Shimla, it was once, home of a British officer Victor Bayley and his wife. Prior to them, an army officer resided in the mansion. The mere sight of the mansion is eerie, which makes it a definite entrant in our list of most haunted places in Shimla.

Both the families have reported uncanny incidents inside the house like sighting a British gentleman who slowly disappears, breaking and crashing things in the house. The activities are quite violent and disturbing.
\nPresently the mansion is owned by an Indian who has refurbished the entire house. Even today, locals report ghostly figures and shadows loitering inside the mansion.
snippet_content:

blog_post_title: 5 Most Haunted Places In Shimla: Exploring The Eerie Side-2
h1_tag: 5 Most Haunted Places In Shimla: Exploring The Eerie Side
h2_tag: 3. Convent of Jesus & Mary, Chotta Shimla
snippet_heading: Convent Of Jesus & Mary, Chotta Shimla
snippet_inner_link: Suggested Read: 10 Best Places To Visit In Shimla To Relax And Unwind
snippet_text:
\nBesides being a well-known convent school in Shimla, Jesus and Mary is popular for more than one eerie stories and incidents; even though most of them appear to be rumors.

There is one story around Friday, the 13, when a headless horseman appears and offers a rose to one of the girls. He takes along ones who agree and kills those who dont. Another folklore talks of a fire in the CJMs dormitory for orphans during British rule. The current play area is where the kids were buried. Of many ghost mentions, there is a young girl who keeps asking for her doll, and other young women who were taken by the horseman.

Adding fuel was a 2012 tragedy, when two IVth standard students were found dead near the school. The family and friends of the victims claimed that they committed suicide because of mental harassment and nuisance by their teachers. Some claim that the building is haunted by their souls too.

blog_post_title: 5 Most Haunted Places In Shimla: Exploring The Eerie Side-3
h1_tag: 5 Most Haunted Places In Shimla: Exploring The Eerie Side
h2_tag: 4. Indira Gandhi Medical College, Lakkar Bazar
snippet_heading: Indira Gandhi Medical College, Lakkar Bazar
snippet_inner_link: Suggested Read: Bhangarh Fort -- The Most Haunted Place In India
snippet_text:
\nIndira Gandhi Medical College is the largest medical set up in not only Shimla but whole of Himachal Pradesh. At the same time, it is also among the most haunted places in Shimla. Patients, their families, doctors and other staff have many times complained of mysterious activities in lifts, corridors and rooms.

Besides weird noises and strange voices, some have also reported being pushing from behind while taking the stairs. Common belief is that all these activities are due to the presence of spirits of the people who have died in the hospital. Even the forest road near the college is said to be spooked by the ghost of an orange seller.

Though there is no reason for these spirits to be haunting the college, the premises are quite scary sometimes.

snippet_text:
Dukhani is a beautiful house at one of the hills of Shimla, said to be haunted by the ghost of an old man, wearing a gown. An old story from the British era tells that he shot himself in the Dukhani house in the same outfit. A spooky occurrence, narrated by Sir John Smithone of the guests at Dukhani, when the place was owned by an old Britisher Buckyis the most popular haunted tale of this house.

During a short stay at Dukhani, Sir John Smith encountered the ghost of the old man in a gown, in the very same room where he had shot himself.

h1_tag: A First-Timer’s Guide To Kasol: Things To Explore, Eat, And Experience
snippet_text: Though Kasol is a year-round destination, it is best visited during the summer months of May and June. However, people also love to visit the destination during the winter months of November to February.
snippet_content:
Best Time To Visit Kasol



Though Kasol is a year-round destination, it is best visited during the summer months of May and June. However, people also love to visit the destination during the winter months of November to February.

blog_post_title: A First-Timer’s Guide To Kasol: Things To Explore, Eat, And Experience-1
h1_tag: A First-Timer’s Guide To Kasol: Things To Explore, Eat, And Experience
h3_tag: Explore the Villages and Treks Around Kasol
snippet_heading: Explore The Villages And Treks Around Kasol
snippet_inner_link: Must Read: 11 Amazing Tree Houses In India: A Treat For Your Younger Self!
snippet_text:
There is no dearth of scenic spots in Kasol, which means youll definitely come back with a lot of DPs and cover pictures. Treks and treads around include journeys to some amazing places near Kasol; such as Sar Pass, Yanker Pass, Pin Parbati Pass, and Kheerganga. You might need to travel small distances in a jeep or a cab to reach the starting place. If tough climb is not your style, take a walk to Chalal, which is just 30 minutes away from Kasol.

For a feel of the rural life in these regions, visit Malana or Tosh. An isolated village 21 kms from Kasol, Malana is still untouched by modern lifestyle. One of the oldest democracies of the world, Malana people claim that they are descendants of Alexanders army, but the claim is highly debatable. Their descent however isnt what makes this place so popular. Its the Malana cream -- premium hashish which is popular among Israelis, Europeans and Indian youth visiting Kasol. Rules of Malana residents are strict with respect to outsiders, but the village and its beauty are a sight to behold. Rocky terrains with pleasing greenery and rural homes are both charming and peaceful.

blog_post_title: A First-Timer’s Guide To Kasol: Things To Explore, Eat, And Experience-2
h1_tag: A First-Timer’s Guide To Kasol: Things To Explore, Eat, And Experience
h2_tag: WHAT TO DO ON YOUR KASOL TRIP-
h3_tag: Things To Do On Your Kasol Trip-For A Memorable Experience
snippet_heading: Things To Do On Your Kasol Trip-for A Memorable Experience
snippet_inner_link:
Must Read: 10 Terribly Overrated Destinations In India & Where To Go Instead

2. Binge on Israeli Food: Lifes good with a Shakshouka, a Bureka, and a lemon cake on my plate.

Image Source

Having covered the best places to visit in Kasol, you’d definitely love on gorge on some amazing food. If you have not tried the cuisine, this is the place to start. Go one dish at a time and keep repeating the ones you like. Dont forget the trout! And desserts are mind-blowing; we recommend Hello to the king and Hello to the queen at The Evergreen and the fresh bakes from The German Bakery at Moon Dance.

3. Stay in a Tent Camp: If you havent done it yet, try it here.

Image Source
snippet_text:
A lot has been written and blogged about the same clich- things to do in Kasol. While not all of them are absolutely useless, theres a lot more to experience here -- simple things that will give you simple joys.

1. Go on Hikes and Treks: Theres nothing more serene that walking along lush greenery.

Kasol offers multiple exploration options for casual walkers, trekkers and everyone who falls between these two categories. Best people to give you an idea of the difficulty level of each are the locals. You could either get in touch with a local when you visit Kasol, or plan your trek in advance with the help of our verified local agents.

2. Binge on Israeli Food: Lifes good with a Shakshouka, a Bureka, and a lemon cake on my plate.

Having covered the best places to visit in Kasol, you’d definitely love on gorge on some amazing food. If you have not tried the cuisine, this is the place to start. Go one dish at a time and keep repeating the ones you like. Dont forget the trout! And desserts are mind-blowing; we recommend Hello to the king and Hello to the queen at The Evergreen and the fresh bakes from The German Bakery at Moon Dance.

3. Stay in a Tent Camp: If you havent done it yet, try it here.


\nConfused about where to stay in Kasol- While there are a few options, but try your luck at the Forest Department tents. Beautifully located beside the fiercely flowing Paravti, they offer one of most gorgeous morning and evening views in the valley. Also, the camps are quite comfortable and neatly maintained. Prices are as low as Rs 150 during the off season and Rs 300 during the peak summer (May-June).

4. Find Peace: Do what you love the most while youre still surrounded by the mighty peaks and a powerful river.

Kasol is the place to stir up old hobbies that get lost in your urban routine. Read a book, pen a prose, sketch/draw/paint, create a song, dream, ponder or do anything that you love doing, in a spot that makes you peaceful inside.

5. Play Games: Have a little fun.

If you have a chance to plan your visit, pack that dusty archery set, the almost lost air gun, or that carelessly tucked away badminton set. If you are in a group, play a game of pithu; volleyball at Cottage Cafe; or carom at Jim Morrison Caf-.

Left (top to bottom): Buddha Place Cafe; Alpine Guest House Cafe
Right (top to bottom): Jim Morrison Cafe; The Evergreen Cafe; Stone Garden Cafe
snippet_content:
Things To Do On Your Kasol Trip-for A Memorable Experience



Image Source

A lot has been written and blogged about the same clich- things to do in Kasol. While not all of them are absolutely useless, theres a lot more to experience here -- simple things that will give you simple joys.

1. Go on Hikes and Treks: Theres nothing more serene that walking along lush greenery.

Kasol offers multiple exploration options for casual walkers, trekkers and everyone who falls between these two categories. Best people to give you an idea of the difficulty level of each are the locals. You could either get in touch with a local when you visit Kasol, or plan your trek in advance with the help of our verified local agents.

2. Binge on Israeli Food: Lifes good with a Shakshouka, a Bureka, and a lemon cake on my plate.

Having covered the best places to visit in Kasol, you’d definitely love on gorge on some amazing food. If you have not tried the cuisine, this is the place to start. Go one dish at a time and keep repeating the ones you like. Dont forget the trout! And desserts are mind-blowing; we recommend Hello to the king and Hello to the queen at The Evergreen and the fresh bakes from The German Bakery at Moon Dance.

3. Stay in a Tent Camp: If you havent done it yet, try it here.


\nConfused about where to stay in Kasol- While there are a few options, but try your luck at the Forest Department tents. Beautifully located beside the fiercely flowing Paravti, they offer one of most gorgeous morning and evening views in the valley. Also, the camps are quite comfortable and neatly maintained. Prices are as low as Rs 150 during the off season and Rs 300 during the peak summer (May-June).

4. Find Peace: Do what you love the most while youre still surrounded by the mighty peaks and a powerful river.

Kasol is the place to stir up old hobbies that get lost in your urban routine. Read a book, pen a prose, sketch/draw/paint, create a song, dream, ponder or do anything that you love doing, in a spot that makes you peaceful inside.

5. Play Games: Have a little fun.

If you have a chance to plan your visit, pack that dusty archery set, the almost lost air gun, or that carelessly tucked away badminton set. If you are in a group, play a game of pithu; volleyball at Cottage Cafe; or carom at Jim Morrison Caf-.

Right (top to bottom): Jim Morrison Cafe; The Evergreen Cafe; Stone Garden Cafe

snippet_text:
If you thought mountains and Malana cream are the only attractions in Kasol, you are wrong. The hippie village offers you abundant options from Israeli, Italian, Chinese and Indian cuisines. Almost all places have Shakshouka, Falafel, Schnitzel, Bourekas, and the desserts at German bakeries are to die for. Some of the popular cafes that must be on check-it-out list are:

1. Stone Garden Caf-: A 24-hour caf- with awesome food and ambience.
2. Freedom Caf-: Its the music and the legacy of freedom cafes that keeps it bustling most time of the year.
3. Jim Morrison Caf-: Great music after a small trek makes it special. Food is all vegetarian though.
4. Shiva Shanti Caf-: Terrace seating allows an enchanting view of the valley and the surrounding peaks.
5. The Evergreen Caf-: Dont miss the church behind and the great food.
6. Moon Dance Caf-: Lovely setting, great food, and irresistibly good bakery.
7. Bhoj Caf-: One of the oldest cafes is a different experience altogether.
8. Buddha Place: Vibrant music and interiors.
9. The Art Caf-: Go here for some peace.
10. Alpine Guest House Caf-: A scenic caf- along the fiercely flowing river Parvati.

snippet_text:
A walled and fortified location, with a castle on the top and a river at the bottom, Toledo whispers romance around every corner. Cobbled streets, ancient walls, cosy restaurants; for a memorable honeymoon in Spain, get happily lost with your loved one in Toledo.
Ideal honeymoon duration: 3 Nights
Honeymoon delights:-Romantic sunsets, beautiful churches, museums, synagogues & mosques and late night dancing on weekends make this city of Spain a perfect honeymooner’s pick!
Why should you go there- One of the oldest city in all over the Europe, it will vow you with its old town charm.
Best time to visit: All through the year.

h2_tag: 4. Andaluc-a – For A Fairytale Honeymoon In Spain
snippet_text:
Undoubtedly, Andalucia makes for a perfect Spanish honeymoon destination. Its got it all – the sun, sea and sand but with a twist. Add to it the remote villages of the Alpujarra, hill top retreats and the gypsy quarters and it is sure to be a memorable trip with your better half.
Ideal honeymoon duration: 7 Nights
Honeymoon delights:-Romance straight out of a hollywood flick! Gypsies, flamenco, matadors, tapas bars, geraniums, and strolling guitarists pull the lovebirds to this gorgeously romantic city.
Why should you go there- Unforgettable natural settings as Sierra de Aracena and Do-ana wetlands, Parque Natural de Cazorla, pueblos blancos and Alpujarras mountains.
Best time to visit: April to June and September to the first half of October.

blog_post_title: The Cursed Ghosts Of Bhangarh Fort – The Most Haunted Place In India-0
h1_tag: The Cursed Ghosts Of Bhangarh Fort – The Most Haunted Place In India
h2_tag: The Haunting History: A Legion Of Bhangarh Fort Haunted Stories
snippet_text:
The Bhangarh fort in Rajasthan was built by King Madho Singh, the younger brother of Emperor Akbars general called Man Singh. It was built after getting approval from ascetic Guru Balu Nath who meditated at this place. According to common folklore, the ascetic made the king swear that the fort shadows would not touch his area of meditation. But the king failed to keep up to his promise. As soon as the shadows touched his spot, Guru Balu Nath cursed the village to remain roofless. Even if a roof is built today, it collapses soon after.

Another story is about tantrik Singhia, who fell in love with Princess Ratnavati. He tried to use magic to win over her, but the princess got to know of his evil plans and ordered to get him killed. Before the tantrik died, he too, cursed the residents of the fort to die and the village dwellers to remain roofless forever.
snippet_content:
The Haunting History



Image Source

The Bhangarh fort in Rajasthan was built by King Madho Singh, the younger brother of Emperor Akbars general called Man Singh. It was built after getting approval from ascetic Guru Balu Nath who meditated at this place. According to common folklore, the ascetic made the king swear that the fort shadows would not touch his area of meditation. But the king failed to keep up to his promise. As soon as the shadows touched his spot, Guru Balu Nath cursed the village to remain roofless. Even if a roof is built today, it collapses soon after.

Another story is about tantrik Singhia, who fell in love with Princess Ratnavati. He tried to use magic to win over her, but the princess got to know of his evil plans and ordered to get him killed. Before the tantrik died, he too, cursed the residents of the fort to die and the village dwellers to remain roofless forever.

blog_post_title: The Cursed Ghosts Of Bhangarh Fort – The Most Haunted Place In India-1
h1_tag: The Cursed Ghosts Of Bhangarh Fort – The Most Haunted Place In India
h2_tag: What Happens in the Bhangarh Fort at Night-
snippet_heading: What Happens In The Bhangarh Fort At Night-
snippet_inner_link: Suggested Read: 10 Scary Secrets Of The Haunted Yet Surreal Cemeteries In India
snippet_text: ASI forbids visitors and locals from hanging around the vicinity of the fort once the sun sets. The warnings about legal actions are not merely out of rumors. People claim to have heard Bhangarh ghosts scream, voices of women crying, sounds of bangles in the rooms, and eerie smells after dusk. Ghostly shadows, strange lights, and unusual sounds of music and dance have also been reported. The brave hearts who dared to stay back after dusk have failed to appear alive the next morning.
snippet_content:

Ghostly shadows, strange lights, and unusual sounds of music and dance have also been reported. The brave hearts who dared to stay back after dusk have failed to appear alive the next morning.

blog_post_title: Bora Bora Honeymoon: 7 Steps To Plan The Extravagant Affair-0
h1_tag: Bora Bora Honeymoon: 7 Steps To Plan The Extravagant Affair
h2_tag: 4. How to get to Bora Bora-
snippet_text:
Flying to Bora Bora is a wonderful experience. You get to see the beautiful islands and their sparkling blue lagoons from the skies above.

Your flight to Bora Bora is divided into two steps.

  • First you must fly into the French Polynesian Faaa International Airport at Papeete on the main island of Tahiti. Direct flights are available from Tokyo (Japan), Auckland (New Zealand), Los Angeles (USA), Honolulu (Hawaii), Santiago (Chile), and Paris (France).
  • From Papeete, Air Tahiti flies to the small islet -- Motu Mute, located to the north of the main island of Bora Bora. This inter-island flight is of 50 minutes and there are a minimum of 5 flights daily.

Note: The Air Tahiti flight to Bora Bora is inclusive of the 25-minutes catamaran rides to the hotels.
snippet_content:
A Flights To Bora Bora



Image Source

blog_post_title: Bora Bora Honeymoon: 7 Steps To Plan The Extravagant Affair-2
h1_tag: Bora Bora Honeymoon: 7 Steps To Plan The Extravagant Affair
h2_tag: 5. And for those romantic honeymoon nights, here are the Best Places to Stay in Bora Bora
snippet_text:
• The St Regis Bora Bora Resort: St Regis Bora Bora Resort opened in 2006 with the largest overwater bungalows in Bora Bora and Tahiti. Located on a thin island (Motu), it offers views of the ocean and the Bora Bora Island. Several areas in the over-water villas have glass-flooring for lagoon viewing.
      • Amenities & Offerings: Spa, beach villas, over-water villas, royal estate, restaurants, private pools, and bar
      • Suggested Stay: Premier Overwater Villa
      • Suggested Dining: Must-try contemporary and pure Japanese flavors at the first Sushi restaurant of the region -- Sushi Take
      • Website | Reviews
    • The Hilton Bora Bora Nui Resort & Spa: The Hilton Bora Bora Nui Resort offers a unique and private location on the back of the volcano island -- Motu Toopua. The white sand beach, surrounded by black basalt rocks and lush vegetation, offers a great experience to the honeymooners. The amazing lagoon and ocean views from the hill-top Hina Spa and the glass-floor viewing panels in the over-water villas make this resort an amazing place to stay. The resort also offers the best snorkeling in Bora Bora.
      • Amenities & Offerings: Spa, infinity pool, jet-skiing, scuba-diving, snorkeling, over-water villas, lagoon view suites, garden & hillside villas, restaurants, and bars
      • Suggested Stay: King Royal Overwater Villa
      • Suggested Dining: Romantic beach dinner facing the lagoon at the Queen Pomare IV private beach on a tiny islet
      • Website | Reviews
    • Four Seasons Bora Bora: The newest resort in Bora Bora, Four Seasons Bora Bora Resort opened in 2008. The villas offer views of the beach, lagoon, and the mountains.
      • Amenities & Offerings: Holistic Spa, Infinity Pool, Fitness Center, Tennis, paddle-boarding, kayaking, windsurfing, over-water villas, beach villas, restaurants, and bar
      • Suggested Stay: Deluxe Lagoon View Overwater Villa
      • Suggested Dining: American breakfast buffet at Tere Nui Restaurant
      • Website | Reviews

There are some great 4-star resorts in Bora Bora, such as the Bora Bora Le Meridian, the Sofitel Bora Bora Beach Resort & Private Motu and the Intercontinental Le Moana Bora Bora, but the one that stands out is the Pearl Beach Resort Bora Bora, located on Motu Tevairoa.

    • Pearl Beach Resort Bora Bora-is a true display of the traditional Tahiti architecture and Polynesian decoration. With a beach that looks like a turquoise salt-water pool and offers-romantic suites-with enclosed terraces, the resort is suggested by most agents.
      • Amenities & Offerings: Manea Spa surrounded by lily ponds, resident tattoo artist, garden suites with private pools, beach suites with private Jacuzzis, restaurants, and bars
      • Suggested Stay: Otemanu View Premium Overwater Bungalow
      • Suggested Dining: Italian dishes, local seafood, and the Polynesian flavors at Fare Ambrosia
      • Website | Reviews

h3_tag: a. Bike Ride Best Mode of Transportation in Bora Bora
snippet_text: The best way to go around in Bora Bora is by the humble two-wheeler, especially because the entire island can be traversed in one afternoon on the bicycle. While many resorts offer complimentary bikes, others may charge up to XPF 1,632 (INR 1,003) per day.
snippet_content:
A Bike Ride



Image Source

The best way to go around in Bora Bora is by the humble two-wheeler, especially because the entire island can be traversed in one afternoon on the bicycle. While many resorts offer complimentary bikes, others may charge up to XPF 1,632 (INR 1,003) per day.

blog_post_title: Bora Bora Honeymoon: 7 Steps To Plan The Extravagant Affair-9
h1_tag: Bora Bora Honeymoon: 7 Steps To Plan The Extravagant Affair
h2_tag: 6. What to do just before you plan- Read Tips on Going around in Bora Bora
snippet_text:
Water taxis are one of the most expensive-modes of getting around Bora Bora. A 2-person ride can cost in the excess of 8,500 XPF (INR 5,200). But similar to the water taxis, there are some complimentary boat shuttles provided by the airport and resorts. Some resorts, however, charge for the scheduled/private boat trips around Bora Bora.
