blog_post_title: Bora Bora Honeymoon: 7 Steps To Plan The Extravagant Affair-10
h1_tag: Bora Bora Honeymoon: 7 Steps To Plan The Extravagant Affair
h2_tag: 7. And now, here is a list of the best things to do in Bora Bora on your honeymoon-
snippet_text:
For those who wish to explore the island, there are many places to visit in Bora Bora. These include the town of Vaitape and the Bloody Marys Restaurant and Bar here, Pofai Bay, TV tower for the view of southern end of the island and the lagoon, Matira Beach and Beach Park, World War II Guns, the local Anau village, Musee De La Marine museum of boats, Taihi Point, and Terei Point.

  • Vaitape: The main town and wharf of the island, Vaitape is a popular tourist attraction of Bora Bora. The Alain Gerbault Memorial is dedicated to the first Frenchman to sail his yacht around the world and finally lived in Polynesia between 1933 and 1940. Additionally, you will find a bank, a post office, a protestant church, a few shops, and cafes. Bloody Marys Restaurant and Bar is the most popular diner in this town.
  • Mount Otemanu: It is one of the two extinct volcanoes at the center of the island. Be it for a dramatic photo or an adventure, Mount Otemanu has a lot to offer. You can hike to the top or go for 4×4 tours, boat tours, or even helicopter tours around the volcano.
  • Matira Beach: Matira Beach is the only public access beach in Bora Bora. The white sand stretches and the crystal clear water add to the beauty of this Bora Bora tourist attraction. However, it is most famously known for the excellent experiences of snorkeling in Bora Bora.
snippet_content:
A Tourist Attractions In Bora Bora



For those who wish to explore the island, there are many places to visit in Bora Bora. These include the town of Vaitape and the Bloody Marys Restaurant and Bar here, Pofai Bay, TV tower for the view of southern end of the island and the lagoon, Matira Beach and Beach Park, World War II Guns, the local Anau village, Musee De La Marine museum of boats, Taihi Point, and Terei Point.

  • Vaitape: The main town and wharf of the island, Vaitape is a popular tourist attraction of Bora Bora. The Alain Gerbault Memorial is dedicated to the first Frenchman to sail his yacht around the world and finally lived in Polynesia between 1933 and 1940. Additionally, you will find a bank, a post office, a protestant church, a few shops, and cafes. Bloody Marys Restaurant and Bar is the most popular diner in this town.
  • Mount Otemanu: It is one of the two extinct volcanoes at the center of the island. Be it for a dramatic photo or an adventure, Mount Otemanu has a lot to offer. You can hike to the top or go for 4×4 tours, boat tours, or even helicopter tours around the volcano.
  • Matira Beach: Matira Beach is the only public access beach in Bora Bora. The white sand stretches and the crystal clear water add to the beauty of this Bora Bora tourist attraction. However, it is most famously known for the excellent experiences of snorkeling in Bora Bora.

Travelling in Seychelles is not a concern. You just need to shell out some bucks. And every place, no matter how secluded, is accessible. You can take your pick from rental bikes, inter-island flights, helicopter rides, ferries, jetties, speed boats, catamarans, taxis, car-hires-for-a-day, and bus.


In total, there are six major airports in The Republic of Seychelles. Two of the most prominent ones are:

  • Seychelles international Airport at Victoria
  • Praslin Island Domestic Airport at Praslin

More than 25 International Airlines operate out of Seychelles International Airport. There are non-stop flights to 14 cities, however, sadly, no Indian city is a part of the group yet. There is a halt at Abu Dhabi for tourists from India. With over 320 international flights departing from Seychelles, it is not a hyperbole to say that it is very well connected to the world.

An average round trip for a person would cost somewhere around INR 90,000.

blog_post_title: Glass Igloo In Finland: A Dream Stay That Must Be In Your 2017 Bucketlist-0
h1_tag: Glass Igloo In Finland: A Dream Stay That Must Be In Your 2017 Bucketlist
h2_tag: Igloo Village of Hotel Kakslauttanen in Finland
snippet_heading: Igloo Village Of Hotel Kakslauttanen In Finland
snippet_inner_link:
Suggested Read: 11 Bewitching Places Of The World Where The Sun Never Sets

Image Source
snippet_text:
The Igloo Village of Hotel Kakslauttanen in Finland is the place where you can live your dream of sleeping in the wilderness and enjoying the stunning views. The Village hotel boasts of 20 glass igloos, which are thermally charged to optimize the outside temperature, which is as low as -30 degree Celsius. These igloos are specially built to prevent frosting on the glass so as to provide an enchanting panoramic view of twinkling stars. And Northern Lights in the months of August to April, if you are very lucky!

The igloos are fitted with thermally insulated walls and ceilings to keep the pad warm and comfortable, even when its frosting cold outside. They can fit two people at a time and are spacious enough to not be crowded.

Even though there is no guarantee of Northern Lights, the hotel keeps a track of the weather and chimes a central bell to give the tourists a heads up of the natural wonder, if there is any chance of its occurrence.

Although the hotel operates all year around, the best time to see the marvel of glass igloos is during the winter months, from October to May. This is the time when the weather is good for most activities. Also the chances are higher for the occurrence of Northern Lights.

Before we get to details, heres a video to make you swoon! The clip shows a couples extraordinary winter holiday at the Igloo hotel.

blog_post_title: Glass Igloo In Finland: A Dream Stay That Must Be In Your 2017 Bucketlist-2
h1_tag: Glass Igloo In Finland: A Dream Stay That Must Be In Your 2017 Bucketlist
snippet_text:
Snowmobile Safari -- Enjoy the best sceneries on these fastest, and most-adrenaline-filled rides. It includes a coffee break and a lunch prepared in open-fire. Also, for the nocturnal lovers, an overnight safari is also an option.

Icebreaker Sampo -- The icebreaker cruise ship is one of the most popular travel attractions in Finland. The day-long trip will take you through the city and give you an opportunity to take a dip in the icy Bay of Bothnia, while dressed in a dry suit.

Skiing and snowboarding -- Two of the best ski fells of Finland are just 15 minutes drive from the resort.

-- You can enjoy the novelty of ice-fishing in Finland. Search for fishing spots and empty the winter nets with the aid of your local guide.

Aurora Hunting -- A nocturnal adventure in the wilderness, wherein you can chase the phenomenal Aurora, or Northern Lights as they are popularly known.

Horse-riding and Sleigh-riding -- Try your hand at winter horseback riding. It’s a must try if you have never experienced the thrill before. Also, no snow vacation is complete without a sleigh ride! Hop on and glide through the pearly ice while musing ‘Jingle bells, jingle bells, jingle all the way…Oh what fun it is to ride on a one-horse open sleigh.

Husky Safari and Reindeer Safari -- Get a feel of steering huskies through the white expanses of snow. Indulge in the reindeer safari and live life, king size; just like the old kings used to!

blog_post_title: The Wondrous Mendenhall Ice Caves Of Alaska-6
h1_tag: The Wondrous Mendenhall Ice Caves Of Alaska
snippet_inner_link: Further Read: 11 Mysterious Places Around The World You Will Not Believe Actually Exist
snippet_text:
The trek begins from the Skaters Cabin Road, located about 10 km from the airport. Cabs can take you to the base-camp in 15 minutes.

The temperatures are sub-zero throughout the day during December -- Mid February. This makes these months the best time to explore the glacier.

  • The ice on the lake is never safe to walk on. The ice thickness may vary due to the flowing water.
  • Icebergs can roll over without warning. And yes, it is possible even when the lake is frozen. This may lead to cracking of the ice sheet.
  • The glacier is constantly splitting into smaller fragments.Ice near the face of the glacier is weaker due to the same reason and result in people falling through the ice.
  • Hurry, before they melt. Yes, the caves are melting and much faster than you could imagine. So, if you are really into visiting this natural wonder, plan it soon.
snippet_content:
From Airport To Skaters Cabin Road



Image Source

  • Icebergs can roll over without warning. And yes, it is possible even when the lake is frozen. This may lead to cracking of the ice sheet.
  • The glacier is constantly splitting into smaller fragments.Ice near the face of the glacier is weaker due to the same reason and result in people falling through the ice.

blog_post_title: Dreaming Of An Exotic Honeymoon In Switzerland? Make It Happen-1
h1_tag: Dreaming Of An Exotic Honeymoon In Switzerland? Make It Happen
h2_tag: Q2. When should you visit Switzerland for honeymoon-
snippet_heading: Q When Should You Visit Switzerland For Honeymoon-
snippet_text:
Lets first have a look at the different elements that will help you understand Switzerland better.

So, the temperature rarely goes beyond 25 degree celsius. The Alps stay snow covered all through the year while the plains have a temperate climate all through the year. April – May and September – October, are arguably the best months to be in Switzerland for honeymoon. The summers are best during mid June while a winter honeymoon in Switzerland is aptly planned from December to March.
snippet_content:

The summers are best during mid June while a winter honeymoon in Switzerland is aptly planned from December to March.

blog_post_title: Dreaming Of An Exotic Honeymoon In Switzerland? Make It Happen-3
h1_tag: Dreaming Of An Exotic Honeymoon In Switzerland? Make It Happen
h2_tag: Q4. What all places should you visit on a Switzerland honeymoon-
snippet_heading: Q What All Places Should You Visit On A Switzerland Honeymoon-
snippet_text:
This one is pretty tough, but we will help you score. Here is a list of some of the most romantic places in Switzerland to ensure that dream honeymoon you have been planning for:

a) Lucerne – Take that unforgettable romantic walk here

Most romantic things to do: Laze around the turquoise blue waters of the lake, roam around hand in hand amidst the stunning serenity of car free town, explore historical mountains, pose by the numerous fountains and get clicked

b) Zurich – Go around exploring the inviting cafes and delish gourmet food

Most romantic things to do: Zurich is the cultural hub – explore the numerous museums, art cafes, and splurge over the local cuisine.

c) Interlaken – Rail through the snow clad mountains

Most romantic things to do: Indulge in adventure sports like skiing, snowboarding and paragliding; lose yourselves in the dumbfounding beauty of the Alps as you board the best of the railways in world with your sweetheart.

d) Jungfraujoch – Hike to the top of Europe

Most romantic things to do: Walk hand in hand with your love till the end of Panorama way –the sunny south facing first slope of the Alps; if you guys are an adventurous couple, this is the place to be – trek to the heights of the top of Europe

e) Lake Geneva – Laze around the Alpine serenity

Most romantic things to do: Laze around in the serenity of Europes largest Alpine lake, go shopping in the UN city, stroll through the numerous gardens parks and promenades.

f) The Matterhorn – For the old school romance in horse carriages

Most romantic things to do: Hiking, biking and climbing; explore the area on horse drawn carriage and try to woo your lady love in some old English style
snippet_content:
Q What All Places Should You Visit On A Switzerland Honeymoon-



Image Source

This one is pretty tough, but we will help you score. Here is a list of some of the most romantic places in Switzerland to ensure that dream honeymoon you have been planning for:

a) Lucerne – Take that unforgettable romantic walk here

Most romantic things to do: Laze around the turquoise blue waters of the lake, roam around hand in hand amidst the stunning serenity of car free town, explore historical mountains, pose by the numerous fountains and get clicked

b) Zurich – Go around exploring the inviting cafes and delish gourmet food

Most romantic things to do: Zurich is the cultural hub – explore the numerous museums, art cafes, and splurge over the local cuisine.

c) Interlaken – Rail through the snow clad mountains

Most romantic things to do: Indulge in adventure sports like skiing, snowboarding and paragliding; lose yourselves in the dumbfounding beauty of the Alps as you board the best of the railways in world with your sweetheart.

d) Jungfraujoch – Hike to the top of Europe

Most romantic things to do: Walk hand in hand with your love till the end of Panorama way –the sunny south facing first slope of the Alps; if you guys are an adventurous couple, this is the place to be – trek to the heights of the top of Europe

e) Lake Geneva – Laze around the Alpine serenity

blog_post_title: Honeymoon In Mahabaleshwar: 7 Amazingly Romantic Ways To Spend It-1
h1_tag: Honeymoon In Mahabaleshwar: 7 Amazingly Romantic Ways To Spend It
snippet_text:
By Air: Take a flight to Pune Airport, and get to Mahabaleshwar by bus or cab. Mahabaleshwar is 120 km away from the airport.
By Train: The place is well connected by train. The nearest railhead to Mahabaleshwar is Wathar, located 60 km away. The best way to reach Mahabaleshwar is via the Pune railway station, located 120 km away.
By Road: Mahabaleshwar is well connected to NH 4 and Mumbai-Pune Expressway. Besides, the Maharashtra State Road Transport connects Mahabaleshwar to cities like Pune, Nasik, Mumbai, Satara, Panchgani, & Kolhapur, and provide frequent transport facilities to people traveling to Mahabaleshwar.
snippet_content:
How To Reach Mahabaleshwar



By Air: Take a flight to Pune Airport, and get to Mahabaleshwar by bus or cab. Mahabaleshwar is 120 km away from the airport.
By Train: The place is well connected by train. The nearest railhead to Mahabaleshwar is Wathar, located 60 km away. The best way to reach Mahabaleshwar is via the Pune railway station, located 120 km away.
By Road: Mahabaleshwar is well connected to NH 4 and Mumbai-Pune Expressway. Besides, the Maharashtra State Road Transport connects Mahabaleshwar to cities like Pune, Nasik, Mumbai, Satara, Panchgani, & Kolhapur, and provide frequent transport facilities to people traveling to Mahabaleshwar.

blog_post_title: Honeymoon In Mahabaleshwar: 7 Amazingly Romantic Ways To Spend It-6
h1_tag: Honeymoon In Mahabaleshwar: 7 Amazingly Romantic Ways To Spend It
h2_tag: Places to Visit for a Delightful Honeymoon in Mahabaleshwar
h3_tag: 1. Row away at the beautiful Venna Lake
snippet_heading: Row Away At The Beautiful Venna Lake
snippet_inner_link: Must Read: Top 15 Places To Visit In Mahabaleshwar
snippet_text:
The Venna Lake at Mahabaleshwar is one gorgeous work of nature. Surrounded by hills and trees on all sides and dotted with colourful boats or Shikaras, it offers a memorable experience to visitors. The bazaar nearby and a number of eating joints lined up outside the lake make it a great destination for honeymoon in Mahabaleshwar.

Best Experience: Take a private boat tour on this silk-like water of this serene lake amidst the breathtaking views of the surrounding hills and let the ride brew love and romance between the two of you.

Tip: Go horse riding near the lake with your maiden.
snippet_content:
Row Away At The Beautiful Venna Lake



Image Source

The Venna Lake at Mahabaleshwar is one gorgeous work of nature. Surrounded by hills and trees on all sides and dotted with colourful boats or Shikaras, it offers a memorable experience to visitors. The bazaar nearby and a number of eating joints lined up outside the lake make it a great destination for honeymoon in Mahabaleshwar.

Best Experience: Take a private boat tour on this silk-like water of this serene lake amidst the breathtaking views of the surrounding hills and let the ride brew love and romance between the two of you.

Tip: Go horse riding near the lake with your maiden.

h3_tag: 2. Play hide and seek in the mysterious chambers of the Pratapgarh Fort
snippet_heading: Play Hide And Seek In The Mysterious Chambers Of The Pratapgarh Fort
snippet_text: Located a mere 24 km from Mahabaleshwar, the Pratapgarh Fort is an important historical landmark near Mahabaleshwar, marking Maratha Empires struggle for Swaraj under Chhatrapati Shivajis command. Pratapgarh Fort is a maze of elegant ponds, chambers, and dark, elongated walkways. Take a road trip to the fort with your better half and lose yourselves into its many mysterious corridors, and into then each others arms…

blog_post_title: Honeymoon In Mahabaleshwar: 7 Amazingly Romantic Ways To Spend It-8
h1_tag: Honeymoon In Mahabaleshwar: 7 Amazingly Romantic Ways To Spend It
h3_tag: 3. Witness the vibrant hues of the sky at Bombay Point & Wilson Point
snippet_heading: Witness The Vibrant Hues Of The Sky At Bombay Point & Wilson Point
snippet_text:
The Bombay Point or Sunset Point located atop a hill, is a famous point in Mahabaleshwar which allows visitors to view the magnificent hues of the sunset blend artistically into the sky. Located on the Old Road that leads to the city of Mumbai, the Bombay Point is among the most magnificent honeymoon places in Mahabaleshwar./p>\n

\n

Wilson Point is the highest point in Mahabaleshwar that gives a splendid view of the stunning hills and greenery around. But what makes it unique is the fact that it is the only point in Mahabaleshwar where both the sunrise and the sunset can be seen. Get to Bombay Point & Wilson Point with your significant other and let the enchanting colours of the sky paint colours of everlasting love and happiness in your marriage while the mountain breeze tickles your senses.

blog_post_title: Honeymoon In Mahabaleshwar: 7 Amazingly Romantic Ways To Spend It-10
h1_tag: Honeymoon In Mahabaleshwar: 7 Amazingly Romantic Ways To Spend It
h2_tag: Places to Visit for a Delightful Honeymoon in Mahabaleshwar
h3_tag: 5. Make everlasting promises of love and togetherness at the Mahabaleshwar Temple
snippet_heading: Make Everlasting Promises Of Love And Togetherness At The Mahabaleshwar Temple
snippet_text: Known for its serene, pure, and tranquil ambience, the Mahabaleshwar Temple, or Mahabali, is a phenomenal example of the Maratha heritage dating back to the 16th century. With its Hemadanta style architecture and frequent tales of Lord Shiva residing there every night, the temple makes up for an amazing Mahabaleshwar honeymoon getaway. Visit the shrine with your beloved and pray before the sacred lingam of Lord Shiva to bless you both with eternal love and the strength to get through crossroads in life, together.
snippet_content:
Make Everlasting Promises Of Love And Togetherness At The Mahabaleshwar Temple



Image Source

Known for its serene, pure, and tranquil ambience, the Mahabaleshwar Temple, or Mahabali, is a phenomenal example of the Maratha heritage dating back to the 16th century. With its Hemadanta style architecture and frequent tales of Lord Shiva residing there every night, the temple makes up for an amazing Mahabaleshwar honeymoon getaway. Visit the shrine with your beloved and pray before the sacred lingam of Lord Shiva to bless you both with eternal love and the strength to get through crossroads in life, together.

h2_tag: Places to Visit for a Delightful Honeymoon in Mahabaleshwar
h3_tag: 6. Let Nature cast a magic spell on your affectionate bond at the Elephants Head Point
snippet_heading: Let Nature Cast A Magic Spell On Your Affectionate Bond At The Elephants Head Point
snippet_text: Located at the extreme end point of the mountain range, the Elephant’s Head Point is a unique natural rock formation in the mountain side that looks like an elephants head. A fascinating location to watch the Sahyadri range, the lush green surroundings with sandy patches beyond them, & the breathtaking views of the sunset, Elephants Head Point makes up for a delightful destination for a honeymoon in Mahabaleshwar.
snippet_content:

blog_post_title: Honeymoon In Mahabaleshwar: 7 Amazingly Romantic Ways To Spend It-12
h1_tag: Honeymoon In Mahabaleshwar: 7 Amazingly Romantic Ways To Spend It
h3_tag: 7. Experience the sweetness of love through a visit to a Strawberry Farm & the Mapro Garden on your Mahabaleshwar honeymoon
snippet_heading: Experience The Sweetness Of Love Through A Visit To A Strawberry Farm & The Mapro Garden On Your Mahabaleshwar Honeymoon
snippet_inner_link:
Further Read: 15 Romantic Honeymoon Places In South India

Planning a trip to Mahabaleshwar
snippet_text:
Take a visit to one of the charming strawberry farms and give your bae a little treat! Relish the luscious flavours of the strawberries, mulberries, raspberries, and blueberries that Mahabaleshwar is famous for and take home buckets to let the fruits blend eternal sweetness into your married life.

You can also visit the Mapro Garden, a unique venture that originated in Mahabaleshwar and is now a blooming brand all over India. Here you can try the enormous variety of delicious food and drink items made out of strawberries like syrups, sauces, jellies, chocolates, mocktail mixtures and much more.

Must Try: Their delicious preparation of Strawberry with Cream will make you want to come back for more.

snippet_text: The trek is 14 km long and usually takes around 5 hours from end to end. The scenic beauty that surrounds the track is hypnotizing. There are several tunnels and railway crossings which you would have to traverse during your trek. Usually a trek of easy to moderate density, it is one of the most scenic treks near Mumbai and Pune.

blog_post_title: 10 Best Resorts In Panchgani To Escape The Metropolitan Chaos And Clutter - S0
h1_tag: 10 Best Resorts In Panchgani To Escape The Metropolitan Chaos And Clutter!
snippet_text:
Located at a distance of just ten kilometres from the Chocolate Plant, Millennium Park Resort allows its guests to indulge in nothing but sheer bliss. With a inhouse restaurant & bar, ayurvedic massage therapy, and a nightclub, there is no need to step out once you’ve arrived at Millennium which happens to be one of the best Panchgani resorts.

Suggested Read: Top 20 Weekend Getaways From Mumbai

Address: S.No. 13, Behind Bharati Vidyapith Panchgani-Mahabaleshwar, Godavali, Satara, Maharashtra
Average Price/Night: INR 1,870 to INR 4,900 (double-sharing basis & tax excluded)
Google Ratings: 3.7/5
Website | Reviews

h1_tag: 10 Best Resorts In Panchgani To Escape The Metropolitan Chaos And Clutter!
snippet_text:
Looking forward to a relaxed vacation amidst seclusion? Then Terra Camp Resort is where you should head. Located at a distance of six kilometres from the Parsi Point, this resort offers a perfect nature retreat with breathtaking views of a mountainous landscape for you to chill with your friends, family, and even all by yourself.

Address: Survey No. 498, Bhilar – Akhigani Road, Akhigani, Panchgani, Satara, Maharashtra
Average Price/Night: INR 2,000 to INR 8,000 (double-sharing basis & tax excluded)
Google Ratings: 3.2/5

snippet_text:
The first thing you’ll notice about this resort is the lush greenery all around. The environs are decorated with colorful flowers which instantly lightens up everyone. With its calm, composed, and scenic surroundings, Hotel Mount Castle is much famed for its enthralling location near the Sydney Point.

Address: Opposite M.R.A. Center, Near Dandeghar Naka, Panchgani, Maharashtra
Average Price/Night: INR 2,800 to INR 6,600 (double-sharing basis & tax excluded)
Google Ratings: 3.6/5

h1_tag: 10 Best Resorts In Panchgani To Escape The Metropolitan Chaos And Clutter!
snippet_text:
Offering the best of hospitality, and top-class services, the real charm of Sahyadris range can only be relished from Hira Baug Resort which is located on top of a hillock in Panchgani. Taking you one step closer to nature, Hira Baug is one of the perfect resorts in Panchgani with swimming pool where one can relish mesmerizing sunset views and relax their mind, body, and soul.

Address: Bhilar Kaswand Road, Bhilar, Panchgani, Maharashtra
Average Price/Night: INR 2,000 to INR 3,000 (double-sharing basis & tax excluded)
Google Ratings: 4.1/5
